Zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt kÃ¶nnen wir noch nicht abschÃ¤tzen, ob dieses Angebot langfristig bestehen bleiben wird. Falls wir eine Entscheidung treffen sollten, den Betrieb einzustellen, werden wir alle Nutzer*innen informieren und die Plattform noch mindestens einen Monat lang weiter in Betrieb halten. Damit sollte allen Nutzer*innen die MÃ¶glichkeit gegeben sein, ihre Daten zu exportieren und ggf. einen Umzug auf eine andere Instanz zu organisieren.

Diese Mastodon-Instanz versteht sich als Angebot von Menschen fÃ¼r Menschen. Wir bitten daher darum, hier von Experimenten mit bots und automatisierten Postings abzusehen. DafÃ¼r eignen sich Instanzen wie beispielsweise botsin.space.

Wir behalten uns vor, den Austausch mit Instanzen zu beschrÃ¤nken bzw. zu blockieren, die aus einem Grund oder mehreren GrÃ¼nden nicht mit unseren Werten und Ãœberzeugungen im Einklang stehen. Beispiele fÃ¼r mÃ¶gliche GrÃ¼nde:

  • Verbreitung von rechtsradikalen oder menschenverachtenden Botschaften
  • Verbreitung von Bildern und Filmen, auf denen sexuelle Gewalt an Kindern zu sehen ist
  • Verbreitung von Holocaust-Leugnungen

Eine Liste der geblockten Instanzen verÃ¶ffentlichen wir am Ende dieser Seite.

Ã„nderungen an diesen Leitlinien oder dem Verhaltenskodex werden sowohl per Mastdon (von TODO) als auch per E-Mail und ggf. unter blog.netzbegruenung.de bekannt gegeben.

Vertraulichkeit und Sicherheit von Direktnachrichten

Mastodon und kompatible Plattformen bieten die MÃ¶glichkeit, nicht-Ã¶ffentliche Direktnachrichten mit anderen Nutzer*innen auszutauschen. Bitte versteht diese Funktion nicht als Ersatz fÃ¼r sichere Nachrichten-Plattformen mit Ende-zu-Ende-VerschlÃ¼sselung. Zieht die nachfolgenden Informationen in Betracht, wenn Ihr entscheidet, fÃ¼r welche Art von Kommunikation Ihr diese Funktion nutzen mÃ¶chtet.

FÃ¼r uns als Betreiber, die NetzbegrÃ¼nung e. V., besteht technisch die MÃ¶glichkeit, Einblick in alle Nachrichten zu nehmen, die Nutzer*innen auf dieser Instanz erhalten oder senden. Das gilt auch fÃ¼r Direktnachrichten. Es ist jedoch Teil unseres SelbstverstÃ¤ndnis als Betreiber von Kommunikationsinfrastruktur, dass wir niemals von dieser MÃ¶glichkeit Gebrauch machen werden. Gleichzeitig ist es nicht ausgeschlossen, dass wir beispielsweise in Fehlermeldungen oder Logs auch mit Inhalten von Direktnachrichten konfrontiert werden, ohne dies zu beabsichtigen.

Die gleichen technische MÃ¶glichkeiten, die wir auf gruene.social haben, haben auch die Admins anderer Instanzen, mit denen Ihr Nachrichten austauscht.

Verhaltenskodex (Code of Conduct)

Als Nutzer*in von gruene.social erkenne ich den folgenden Verhaltenskodex an und erklÃ¤re, mich dem entsprechend zu verhalten.

  • Ich achte die WÃ¼rde meiner Mitmenschen und Mitnutzer*innen.
  • Ich beachte die geltenden Gesetze, insbesondere das Urheberrecht, das PersÃ¶nlichkeitsrecht und den Datenschutz.
  • Sollte ich Inhalte, insbesondere Ton, Video und Bild, verÃ¶ffentlichen, die andere verstÃ¶ren kÃ¶nnten, beispielsweise durch Darstellung von Gewalt, verwende ich die Funktion "als heikle Medien markieren".
  • Sollte ich eine Verletzung der Regeln dieses Kodex bemerken, nehme ich das nicht stillschweigend hin, sondern informiere ich die Moderator*innen @moderation.
Short: Die Mastodon-Instanz fÃ¼r BÃœNDNIS 90/DIE GRÃœNEN, betrieben von NetzbegrÃ¼nung e.V.

Description:
This instance is open for all who are open to all. The intention is for it to be for folks in the legal and legal-adjacent fields, but we aren't checking bar cards so you might sneak in if you're well behaved and merely harbor an interest. :-)

We have a Patreon over here to keep up with server costs. Any help is appreciated, but no stress:

https://patreon.com/esqsocial

Additionally, we have a BuyMeACoffee for one-time donations:

https://www.buymeacoffee.com/esqsocial

We abide by the Mastodon Server Covenant, available here.
Short:
A Mastodon instance for legal professionals and folks in law-adjacent fields. 

We abide by the Mastodon Server Covenant, available (here)[https://joinmastodon.org/covenant].

Description:
Toot as in train sound ğŸš‚, pizza as in pizza ğŸ•

Instance info

This is an NYC-based instance for transit and urbanism nerds. We're NYC-leaning but welcome anyone who cares about building better cities.

Funding

I am currently funding this myself, and can do so because I am privileged and my job pays well. As the server grows, I'll start something to cover scaling costs.

Code of Conduct

The current admins are:

  • @embeaken

We want this to be a fun, pleasant, and harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion. We do not tolerate harassment of participants in any form. Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

Harassment:

Harassment includes:

  • Offensive comments related to gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, disability, mental illness, neuro(a)typicality, physical appearance, body size, race, or religion
  • Unwelcome comments regarding a personâ€™s lifestyle choices and practices, including those related to food, health, parenting, drugs, and employment.
  • Deliberate misgendering or use of â€˜deadâ€™ or rejected names
  • Gratuitous or off-topic sexual images or behavior in spaces where theyâ€™re not appropriate
  • Simulated physical contact (e.g. textual descriptions like â€œhugâ€ or â€œbackrubâ€) without consent or after a request to stop.
  • Threats of violence
  • Incitement of violence towards any individual, including encouraging a person to commit suicide or to engage in self-harm
  • Deliberate intimidation
  • Sustained disruption of discussion
  • Unwelcome sexual attention
  • Continued one-on-one communication after requests to cease
  • Publication of non-harassing private communication

Reporting

If you are being harassed, notice that someone else is being harassed, or have any other concerns, please contact the admins. They'll respond as promptly as they can.

We will respect confidentiality requests for the purpose of protecting victims of abuse. At our discretion, we may publicly name a person about whom weâ€™ve received harassment complaints, or privately warn third parties about them. We will not name harassment victims without their affirmative consent.

Consequences

Participants asked to stop any harassing behavior are expected to comply immediately.

If a participant engages in harassing behavior, the admins may take any action they deem appropriate, up to and including expulsion from this instance and identifying the participant publicly as someone about whom we've received complaints.

Credits and License

This code of conduct is based on Annalee Flower Horne's Sample Slack Code of Conduct, which is in turn based on Geek Feminism's Community Anti-Harassment Policy. We have adapted the Sample Slack Code of Conduct for our own use under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution License.
Short: An NYC-based instance geared towards urbanism and transit nerds.

Description:
For gearheads, by gearheads â€” a federated network for those into gear: the heavy stuff, the light wear, the fetish made, the safety built, and everything in-between.

âš¡ï¸ Background

Due to increasing tensions relating to Twitter, niche groups who once called it home feel it is slowly crumbling away. As such, many people are jumping across to Mastodon â€” and this includes the relatively small, but substantial, assemblage of gearheads.

And so, Gearheads, starting out (and still existing) as a Telegram group of the same name, is now one of many many growing Mastodon providers. We aim to provide a safe space for those into the gear kink, as well as stable platform for your content.

Like every Mastodon provider, this one can talk across the federated network, allowing users from other providers to interact with it: if you already have a Mastodon account elsewhere, there's no need to even join this one! It's like your email: you only need one address to message anyone in the world.

Still confused about federation or Mastodon? See fedi.tips for more.

ğŸ†˜ Need help?

If a post is bothering you, please use the Report @user feature under a post's overflow menu. We'll get on it as soon as we can.

Any other issues or concerns can be raised by tagging @staff, or tagging us directly:

  • Astra: @astra@gearheads.social
  • Ducky: @ducky@gearheads.social
  • Kalibur: @KaliburVuhuni@gearheads.social

As a last-ditch attempt, you can also shoot an email to hello@gearheads.social.

ğŸ’¸ Donations

Like literally every decent Mastodon instance, we are entirely ad-free and rely solely on the (sometimes shallow) pockets of its owners and tips for a lovely users. Considering chipping in if you can: our goal stands at just Â£12/mo.
Short: For gearheads, by gearheads â€” a federated network for those into gear: the heavy stuff, the light wear, the fetish made, the safety built, and everything in-between.

Description:
NeoVibe is Mastodon community with a focus on gaming, music, movies & all forms of pop culture. We are LGBTQIA+ friendly and welcome members from all walks of life! So feel free to talk about whatever is on your mind.

If you see an account, a message or any content that violates server rules, please use the report button so our moderators can take action immediately!

We adhere to the Mastodon Server Covenant for moderation, backups, access to infrastructure and communication if we shut down. Our servers are based in North America. We currently operate using a web load balancers and separate Redis, Postgres, Sidekiq and Streaming servers to optimize performance.

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.
Short: LGBTQIA+ friendly community that aims to provide a safe and friendly environment for all members. Anyone is welcome to join! Love and respect are the vibes.

Description:
Federation policy

For security and safety reasons, we do not presently publish our instance-wide moderation policies to the public, but instance users may view the policy by logging in.

Utmost care is taken to prevent metadata leakage to other instances, including the use of authenticated object fetch requirements. Administrators of other instances are encouraged to send any concerns or questions to the admin team concerning our instance-wide moderation policies, including to request a list in Mastodon's standard CSV format of current moderation policies.

Moderation policy (Code of Conduct)

User behavior and content are required to comply with US federal laws and the Revised Code of Washington. Content and behavior which is not in compliance is expressly forbidden and may result in account termination and, in some cases, reporting to authorities as required for our own compliance.

User behavior and content is also expected to abide by the server rules, outlined below:

Organization and project accounts are by invitation only.

Accounts belonging to organizations and project accounts are by invitation of the moderation team. These accounts are expected to uphold the values of this community to a greater extent than normal accounts.

For a multitude of reasons, corporate accounts are not welcome on Treehouse. We recommend running dedicated instances for corporations.

Identity verification requirement to use this server.

In order to sign up for an account, your identity must either be verified by the moderation staff, or you must be explicitly invited to use the instance by a current member.

To streamline the identity verification process, please provide links to other examples of your presence online. This will allow our team to determine if you would be a good fit for our community.

Be kind to each other.

To foster a healthy community, we expect interactions to be kind and empathetic. If you find yourself getting annoyed or frustrated with a conversation, we encourage you to step away for a moment and regroup your thoughts.

No violence.

Content which describes explicit violence towards others is explicitly forbidden. Ranting and similar content is allowed but it may be beneficial to the community at large and its moderation staff to use a content warning to clarify the intention behind the content.

No fascism, white supremacy, etc.

Content relating to fascism, neo-fascism, Trumpism, white supremacy, male supremacy, alt-right ideology, and so on, is explicitly forbidden. Accounts trafficking in this content will be banned with no possibility of appeal.

No colonialism or nationalism.

Content relating to nationalist or colonialist ideology is explicitly forbidden. Accounts trafficking in this content will be banned with no possibility of appeal.

No racism, homophobia, transphobia, etc.

This instance is intended to be a safe space for LGBTQIA+ and PoC people. Accounts which are not compliant with this policy will be banned with no possibility of appeal.

No religious extremism.

Content relating to the promotion of religious extremist ideology is not allowed, for the same reasons that all of the other content types above are not allowed. Accounts trafficking in this content will be banned with no possibility of appeal.

Use content warnings for explicit content.

Explicit content such as, but not limited to, adult content, content including extreme gore, depictions of violence, and any content which may trigger panic responses in individuals with common phobias (such as arachnophobia) must be marked sensitive and content warned.

If moderators have to fix your posts to comply with this policy, you will be given a warning. After multiple warnings, your account may be suspended or terminated at the discretion of the moderation staff.

Reporting violations of this Code of Conduct.

Users may report content which they believe to be either illegal or a violation of server rules in the Mastodon web interface.
Short: A community of friends mostly surviving in the technology industry.  If you sign up, please provide a Twitter, GitHub, or personal blog or website link for us to get to know you better.

Description:
ğŸ‘¥ Community

This is a place for musicians to interact, but you can bring your whole self.

You don't have to be a professional musician to join, but you should at least play an instrument or sing as a hobby.

Click here for more info.

Moderators

  • @cambraca
  • @DebonaireToast
  • @ThunderComplex

ğŸ¶ Musicians.Today Jam Band

Mastodon on the tuba,
kangaroo on the didgeridoo,
otter on the concertina,
hyena on the bass,
capybara on the charango,
red panda on the taiko drum, and
long-billed curlews on the marimba!

Illustration by Averil. Â© 2023 DoomBloomArt

ğŸ“¢ Promote yourself

Sharing your own music is strongly encouraged, even (especially!) if it's not polished. Recommending other people's music is allowed, but it should be clear that you're not sharing your own work. Basically, you must follow copyright law and avoid plagiarism of any kind.

Self-promotion is allowed and welcome! However, Musicians.Today is a place for people; it is not a job network, marketing platform, or storefront. Operate your account as yourself, and do not engage in excessive unsolicited marketing or promotion. Do not post sponsored content or promotional campaigns and contests.

If you use Spotify you can follow this playlist, which includes amazing music created by the people on this instance. Thanks to @radioanywhere for creating it! If you want to be included in this playlist (or excluded!), shoot a message to @radioanywhere or @cambraca.

ğŸ“” Guidelines

Do not post excessively large media files. This server is maintained as a hobby, and storage space is not unlimited. Instead, it is preferred to link to media content hosted by servers intended for this purpose.

Use content warnings (CW) for anything that you think might be uncomfortable for people to see. This may include politics, upsetting news, discussions about other social media, spoilers, etc.

Strive for accessibility. Always add descriptions for any images and media that you post, this helps people with disabilities see your content. Also, hashtags with multiple words should be capitalized #LikeThis, so that screen readers can read them properly.

ğŸ’° Donations

This server is maintained as a side project by real people, not a company. You can contribute using this Patreon page: patreon.com/MusiciansToday, however, donating will never be a condition to joining.

â• Additional services

Translation

Translation is enabled using DeepL Translate.

Search

Full-text search is enabled using ElasticSearch (however, you can only search for posts related to yourself).

â„¹ï¸ More information

Check out info.musicians.today for a lot more information and cool things.
Short: Fediverse community for musicians of all levels, instruments, regions, languages, and genres.

Description:
This Mastodon server is for anyone interested in #Genealogy. It is open to anyone, however it helps if you have a keen interest in the topic as the 'local' feed will be Family Research heavy.

Genealysis.social is run as a free service, but if you ever wished to make a small donation you can find details here.

The site abides by the Mastodon Server Covenant keeping you safe and secure.

Service based in the UK
Short: Social interaction for anyone interested in #Genealogy.

Description:
The cool thing about Mastodon, is you can create these niche servers for your tribe. I'm a gay guy, and I love soccer, cycling, camping, and having adventures. I thought it would be cool to make a server for all my fellow LGBTQIA+ (and Allies) who are into adventure, are sports fans, like hiking and camping, etc.

We don't tolerate any hate speech here, so don't be a tool!

Staff

Admin: @aggiepm

Handling Harassment

If you are being harassed, please report the user using the "â€¦" button and then "Report." For urgent concerns, please DM a moderator. If you engage in harassing behavior, the moderator may take any action they deem appropriate, such as a warning or an expulsion. The above rules may change at any time, and you may be banned at any time based on the moderators' judgment.

File Limits

Photos have a maximum file size of 10MB and videos have a maximum file size of 40MB.

Data Location

Uploaded files are held in an Amazon AWS S3 bucket and database info is in an Amazon RDS instance
Short:
Server for those LGBTQIA+ (and Allies) that are into fun adventurous things, like playing/watching sports, hiking, camping, etc!
#sports #hiking #camping #adventure #LGBT #LGBTQIA

Description:
Epicure.social is a Mastodon server for people interested in food, wine and other adult beverages. Our community includes journalists, chefs, sommeliers, winemakers, beer geeks, cheese fans, bloggers and many who just love good food and wine - and want to chat about it.

All epicurians are welcome, but you need to provide a "reason for joining" when you register. Please make it clear that you have a genuine interest in food or wine. If you only write "I like food" or "Want to get off twitter" we will reject your application.

We ask that our users are respectful and inclusive. Epicure.social is intended to be a welcoming environment that fosters sharing and meaningful discourse. Our moderation takes a light touch, but we will intervene if bad actors attempt to derail these aims. You can find more detailed information about what we do and don't allow, towards the bottom of this text.

As with most Mastodon servers, when you register here, you'll be able to connect with Mastodon users anywhere in the world, on any of the many thousands of other Mastodon servers.

Epicure.social is run on an entirely non-profit basis by The Morning Claret and @simonjwoolf. We created this server because we love the Mastodon concept, and like many of you, we want a better future where social media allows us to connect without sponsored posts, obtuse algorithms or toxic timelines.

We fully subscribe to and comply with the Mastodon Server Covenant. That means:

  • Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia
  • Daily backups
  • At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure
  • Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

Detailed rules

The following guidelines are not a legal document, and the final interpretation is up to the epicure.social administrators. This information is provided as a guide only. Our decision is final in all cases relating to moderation.

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline:

  • Clearly corporate or otherwise excessive advertising
  • Uncurated news bots posting from third-party news sources
  • Pornography and sexually explicit content, including artistic depictions
  • Nudity, unless hidden with a "sensitive content" warning.
  • Untagged gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions.
  • Any other content whose purpose is purely offensive or malicious, in the opinion of our moderation team

The following types of content will be removed from the public timeline, and may result in account suspension and revocation of access to the service:

  • Racism or advocation of racism
  • Sexism or advocation of sexism
  • Casteism or advocation of casteism
  • Discrimination against gender and sexual minorities, or advocation thereof
  • Xenophobia or offensive nationalism
  • Spreading disinformation or conspiracy theories that undermine public health

The following types of content are explicitly forbidden and will result in revocation of access to the service:

  • Sexual depictions of children
  • Content illegal in Germany (where epicure.social is hosted) or the Netherlands (where epicure.social is registered), including holocaust denial or Nazi symbolism
  • Conduct promoting the ideology of National Socialism
  • Any conduct intended to stalk or harass other users, or to impede other users from utilising the service, or to degrade the performance of the service, or to incite other users to perform any of the aforementioned actions, is also forbidden and will lead to revocation of access to the service. This includes, but is not limited to, the following behaviours:
    • Continuing to engage in conversation with a user that has specifically requested for said engagement to cease and desist, regardless of platform-specific privacy tools employed.
    • Aggregating, posting, and/or disseminating a person's demographic, personal, or private data without express permission (informally called doxing or dropping dox)
    • Inciting users to engage another user in continued interaction or discussion after a user has requested for said engagement to cease and desist (informally called brigading or dogpiling)
These provisions notwithstanding, the administrator of epicure.social reserves the right to revoke any user's access permissions, at any time, for any reason, except as limited by law.

Media Retention

We retain local media files for as long as your account remains active. Cached media from other servers is deleted after 30 days.

Donations

If this instance becomes popular and we need to scale up the hosting resources, we will request donations to help with the running costs. For now, this is not necessary.

Bot Accounts

Bot accounts are allowed, but you need to set the post visibility to unlisted and mark your accounts to Bot.

Blocked Countries

This list will be updated as and when necessary.

Epicure Moderator Team

We will seek volunteer moderators to help as this Mastodon instance grows. For now, moderation is handled by

@morningclaret @simonjwoolf @stephendwolff

Please contact us at mastodon@themorningclaret.com if you are interested in being a member of this team.

Limitation of liability

This website is provided to you "as is". The owner and administrators of epicure.social accept no liability for any loss or damage that may occur as a result of your use of this site. It is your responsibility to back up any data or media files that you wish to retain in perpetuity, and we accept no liability whatsoever for data loss.
Short: A Mastodon community with a food and wine focus. Mainly English speaking, open to all epicurians.

Description:
Status page:

https://status.urusai.social/

Alternative UI 'Elk' for Twitter users

If you're coming from Twitter and want a familiar experience to start out, try Elk

Urusai! Social is...

...a toxicity-free, English-first anime/manga and otaku community. We're focused on providing a safe place for fans of otaku culture to share their interests, whatever they are.

Federation Relays:

This server uses relays to increase the variety and quantity of content on the Federated timeline. Current relays in use are:

https://relay.neovibe.app/inbox

https://relay.sakurajima.moe/inbox

Defederation:

Urusai! aggressively defederates with servers that may violate our Code of Conduct, based on information provided by other server admins. We do not publish our block-list here to prevent bots from scraping it and notifying bad actors, but you can find it in our git repo

We are a "block first, ask questions later" community. Any server block may be challenged by any Urusai! user and an audit will be performed to determine if they should stay blocked.

Code of Conduct:

rules.urusai.social/mastodon-coc.html. TLDR: be a sensible, nice human being. Harassment, insults, bigotry etc. won't be tolerated.

Usage Guidelines:

rules.urusai.social/mastodon-guidelines.html. TLDR: it's mostly about things that might interest fans of anime and other otaku stuff. Preferred language is English.

This server is run by @neatchee; let me know if you have any issues or suggestions, or see inappropriate activity. If you'd like to contribute to server costs and snacks for contributors you can donate on ko-fi

Additional Attributions:

The custom glitch flavors/styles 'Gekka', 'Sakura', and 'Holiday' are graciously provided via AGPL by chikorita157 of sakurajima.moe and can be found in their GitHub repo

'Vanilla modern' uses CSS provided by Freeplay while other '-modern' variants were adapted by chikorita157

The 'Birdsite' style provided by ronilaukkarinen

DMCA Takedown Requests:

Only content posted by users with "@urusai.social" in their username is managed by this server. If you find infringing material from a user on our server, make sure it is not covered by Fair Use, then send your takedown request to this instance's admin email (neatchee@ansemreport.com). Agent Registration: DMCA-1044853
Short: A friendly and non-toxic English-first Mastodon community for anime, manga, and other otaku subjects.

Christoph Hottenroth
Steinstr. 9

Terms of use


metalverse.social server is run and provided voluntarily. There are some rules to make living together peacefully possible. You accept these rules by creating an account on this server.

In general German law applies to this instance, since the service is run in a german datacenter. Violation of these laws will be prosecuted. Additionally the server rules apply.

The provider of this service will remove content at his own discretion if it does not suit a free, peaceful and tolerant world. In this case, the author of the concerning content will be notified.

Downloading user posts from this instance for the purpose of AI training is prohibited.


Community-Guidelines in a nutshell


â€Behave nice and respect each otherâ€œ
Short:
metalverse.social is a Mastodon instance hosted in Germany from Metalheads for everybody. 
-Where the Metal connects-

Description:
Welcome to Federated Fandom! We are a Mastodon instance focused on fandom, run by @imp and @kate.

Support Us

You can support Federated Fandom on Patreon. Our hosting costs are around $90/month; this includes generous disc space to allow us to grow.

Backup Policy

We have daily automatic backups from our hosting provider. We also encourage you to make use of Mastodon's native data backup features, which you can find in "Import and export" under "Preferences" in the web app.

Server Policy

We use a cloud hosting provider. Users can expect at least 24 hours' notice for planned downtime such as upgrades, and 1 months' notice should be instance be unavailable for a significant period of time (major migration, permanent shutdown).

Moderation Policy

Our server's blocklist is available to logged-in users. If you have questions about a URL or are trying to follow someone from a blocked instance, please email or DM one of the admins to discuss. We are trying to provide a pleasant environment for everyone but obviously the nature of implementing a blocklist means we might've caught some friendlies.

All new moderation actions will be announced via @masto_admin and discussed on Discord. We are still working out our policy on how to collect feedback for moderation decisions, but please do talk to us if you have any questions or feedback: we are here to help and want you to have a good time.

You can find our Discord invite here.

Server Limiting Policy

In general, we don't want to limit servers that our users find valuable. The below describes criteria we use when deciding whether or not to limit a server. We discuss these limits on Discord and will not limit if a majority of our users do not want us to.

  • We may limit servers which are primarily NSFW and do not enforce CW/sensitive media marking.
  • We may limit servers which are exceptionally chatty and off-topic (such as news aggregation servers). This prevents them from showing up in the Federated timeline but does not prevent you from following accounts or seeing their content in your Home timeline.
  • We may limit individuals from external instances that are exceptionally chatty and off-topic. This is to prevent the Federated timeline from being full of content that may be relevant to one or two users but is unrelated to fandom. These limiting activities do not prevent you from following limited individuals or boosting their posts.

Server Blocking Policy

We will block servers which engage in harassing behavior or share illegal/dangerous content. Blocking removes all content from our server and prevents our users from finding or following accounts on the blocked server.
Short: This is a fandom instance run by imp (stopthatimp on Tumblr) and kate (madecunningly on tumblr). We are here to have fun.

Description:
bookstodon welcomes bibliophiles, bookworms, book lovers, and all things bookish

Pull up a chair and follow your favorite hashtags, genres, and authors as they find the way to the fediverse!

Description:
High Performance Computing and related fields, including Big Data, Research Computing, and related hardware and software optimized for these fields, including research software engineering and development, cloud and data center operations, and career development for people involved or interested in these fields. This is primarily a resource for exchange of information among people interested in or working in HPC, and is one of several projects of the hpc.social community-based domain. Please visit that web site or contact info@hpc.social for more information.

This server instance is hosted on behalf of hpc.social by toot.io and its conditions of service delivery incorporate those of this hosting service. Please refer to the terms of service, privacy policy, and other information about toot.io hosting for additional details. These conditions apply in addition to the privacy policy for this server and other conditions described in the server rules listed below. Please use the contact information above or on the main hpc.social web site if you have any questions or concerns. Additional information on server policies and DMCA reporting is available in the policies repository for this service. You may mute, block, or report any post if needed using the options under the three-dot icon under that particular post. You may also contact the mast.hpc.social moderators directly if needed.

Please follow the Sponsor link below to help support this Mastodon instance and other hpc.social services listed on the hpc.social web site . Thanks!

Current Sponsors:


This support is provided either directly or by contributions made through our GitHub Sponsors page. Thanks for helping to support the hpc.social community services!
Short: Mastodon instance to support and encourage communication among the High Performance Computing community and related fields. (Personal use permitted.) More community features at https://hpc.social

Description: The Library of the Uncommons is a gathering place for those seeking to expand their literary horizons and share in their journey with others. No one genre is favored here in particular; readers are simply encouraged to explore that which excites them.
Short: The Library of the Uncommons is a gathering place for those seeking to expand their literary horizons and share in their journey with others.

Description:
VocaLounge is a Mastodon instance centered around Vocaloid, UTAU, and anything to do with vocalsynth culture, dedicated to fostering a lively and active social media community. Anyone is welcome to join, whether youâ€™re a content creator or a fan, or simply just want to come chat with a bunch of vocalsynth people! For more information on what Mastodon is and how it works, you can read about it here and check out the Mastodon documentation. You can also check out some tips on using Mastodon to its full potential here!

VocaLounge was made with the following primary goals in mind:

  • To provide a warm, safe, positive space for vocalsynth community members to socialize;
  • To provide a comfortable and accessible space for people to try out Mastodon/fediverse, even if they ultimately choose to migrate elsewhere;
  • To help vocalsynth community members, who span a wide range of interests across a wide range of instances, stay connected and accessible to each other.

If you like VocaLounge, consider donating to sustain server and hosting costs via LiberaPay or ko-fi.

â€»ã“ã®ã‚¤ãƒ³ã‚¹ã‚¿ãƒ³ã‚¹ã¯ä¸»ã«è‹±èªã§ã™ãŒã€ ãŠå•ã„åˆã‚ã›ã®å ´åˆã€ã‚µã‚¤ãƒˆç®¡ç†è€…ã®@LystrialleãŒæ—¥æœ¬èªã§è©±ã™äº‹ãŒå‡ºæ¥ã¾ã™ã€‚

We are a primarily English-speaking instance, and our moderation team is also English-speaking. We are open to non-English speakers joining or federating with us, but our team may not be able to actively vet non-English content to the same degree we normally would, and in the case of a potential concern we may request external assistance to help translate and interpret. Our web admin @Lystrialle also speaks conversational Japanese and will be willing to directly assist in any inquiries relevant to the Japanese side of our community.

Code of conduct

Etiquette

  • Although this is a vocalsynth-themed instance, off-topic posts are fine! Post to your heart's desire about any topic you like, whether it's photos of your cat, or what you had for lunch today, or even fanart of your favorite video game!
  • In general, we recommend you make extensive use of hashtags whenever possible, to help others easily find what theyâ€™re looking for (ex. #vocaloidart, #vocaloidoriginal, etc.). This especially applies to non-vocalsynth posts, both so that they can federate to other instances, and so that they can be properly caught by user filters.
  • Please be mindful of others and use CWs and the â€œsensitiveâ€ media marking for potentially sensitive content, plot spoilers, or anything else that should be kept behind a warning.
  • If you expect to be posting a long thread, please consider posting any contents after the initial post as unlisted, to prevent the entire contents of the thread from filling up the timeline without context.
  • While we encourage everyone to have fast-paced fun at their leisure, please also be mindful of the local timeline and try not to be overly spammy/disruptive.
  • We ask that personal disputes are settled over private conversations when possible, and that users report anything they see in violation of the rules. We also encourage use of the muting and blocking functions to curate their own feed, regardless of whether moderator intervention is requested or not.

Prohibited behavior

  • We follow the Mastodon Server Covenant, especially part 1: â€œUsers must have the confidence that they are joining a safe space, free from white supremacy, anti-semitism and transphobia of other platforms.â€ Therefore, we hold a zero-tolerance policy towards intolerance that would prevent this from being a safe space for our members. Unwelcome harassments or microaggressions of this sort, whether carried out on VocaLounge or outside, will result in removal from the instance.
  • In general, we also would like to create a civil atmosphere free of ad hominem attacks, harassment, disrespect, or violations of privacy. Engaging in such deliberate behavior, whether on VocaLounge or outside, in such a way that makes other users feel uncomfortable or threatened, will be subject to disciplinary action.
  • Attempts to circumvent disciplinary action by making alternate sockpuppet accounts will result in immediate removal from the instance.

Content policy

  • As this is meant to be an all-ages instance, pornography is not allowed. Material potentially NSFW (not safe for work) -- anything you wouldnâ€™t want your parents to see on your screen, including extreme gore/violence -- must be properly kept behind a CW. (For our policy on interacting with instances that may allow 18+ content, see our federation restriction policy.)
  • In order to protect the rights of content creators that are so integral to the vocalsynth community, unauthorized reprints or reposts of other peopleâ€™s work are not allowed. This extends to posting of links that lead to reposted work, as well as usage of art in icons and banners. Willful disregard of this rule, or findings of explicit art/content theft, will result in removal from the instance. We suggest that users use VocaDB (for videos and audio) or SauceNAO/TinEye (for images) if they wish to properly track down the source for any works they would like to share and recommend to others.
    • "Nightcore" mixes of songs will be considered tantamount to a repost.
    • Provided compliance with the policies of the involved parties and companies, posting of official commercial and publicity artwork is allowed.
    • Photos of merchandise (official or indie/doujinshi) are considered fair game, although they should be credited when feasible. Sharing photos of artbooks (official or doujinshi) is allowed, but publicly uploading scans of them will be considered piracy and subject to removal.
    • We will not request removal of works uploaded by a user authorized to post them (for instance, commissioned art or authorized reposts). We will generally hold good faith that people claiming authorization have indeed acquired the necessary permissions, but we will honor any artists' requests to have their work taken down if they object to its presence here.
  • As our community is dependent on the resources and creations supporting us, many of which come from small independent creators, public advocacy of piracy and links to or instructions for downloading pirated material are not allowed and will be subject to removal.
  • Usage of materials or works in ways that violate the original creator's usage policy (e.g. unauthorized edits or usage of MMD models against their original terms of usage) will be subject to removal and potential disciplinary action.
  • As per the culture of our community, we are naturally friendly towards fanwork, but we reserve the right to take down material at the request of the original work's creator.
  • Bots that cycle posts (i.e. post the same thing at set intervals) must post them as unlisted or followers-only; they may not be posted to the local timeline. (If your account is a dedicated bot, we recommend you make it on botsin.space instead.)
  • Automated crossposts from Twitter (such as with the Mastodon Twitter Crossposter or Moa Bridge) are fine, but crossposting for Twitter retweets and quotes must be disabled (for various reasons, including high potential for reposted artwork). Failure to comply may result in silencing (removing an account from view of anyone not following it) or disabling of the account's functions.

Our moderation team will do everything within the range of feasibility to monitor VocaLounge's environment and ensure rule compliance; however, since we are ultimately a bunch of humans and cannot realistically catch everything at once (especially from the federated feed), we ask that our users please assist us in reporting rule-violating content in order to bring it to our attention.

We will treat users possessing good faith with respect and sympathy, and actively work with them to ensure rule compliance. We also understand that there may be "borderline cases" where subjective judgment about rule adherence will be required. In said cases, final decisions will be left to the moderation team.

Federation

Federation with VocaLounge

We recognize that vocalsynth community members come from a diverse range of backgrounds and hobbies, and that some will likely want to be connected to our instance from a different one. We have a federation ambassador account designed to help vocalsynth community members from other instances federate into our instance; following it will allow them to appear in our federated feed, and making their hashtagged posts searchable to VocaLounge users. Please note that as of this writing, this account is manually operated, and will follow back in accordance with VocaLounge rules.

We are actively friendly towards other vocalsynth-centric instances (such as Vocalodon). If you are an admin or moderator of one, or are interested in making one, please contact one of our administrators (@Lystrialle or @MystSaphyr) if you are interested in discussing interaction between our communities. Due to our community's roots in music and art, we are also actively friendly towards other creative and artistic instances and are happy to discuss any inquiries about federation or community interaction.

We also hope to ensure that content from our instance does not cause problems for other instances, and our admins are happy to converse with the staff of other friendly instances in the hopes of maintaining good relations.

Restrictions

Mastodon provides us with a variety of functions to place differing levels of restrictions on content coming from certain instances, ranging from requiring click-through to see media from an instance, to hiding an instanceâ€™s posts user from direct view to anyone not following them, to outright blocking anything coming from an instance. In most cases, we wish to encourage content to freely flow to and from our instance and throughout the fediverse, allowing peopleâ€™s works and ideas to branch out into the world. However, our priority is first and foremost to continue maintaining the safety of our users who may not wish to be accidentally exposed to something harmful to them without warning, and to maintain VocaLounge's nature as a safe space.

If we determine at any point that an instance actively cultivates a culture of hate speech or content that is threatening to our users, to the extent that affiliation with said instance fundamentally indicates affiliation with said culture, we will immediately block off communication to and from the instance. We will block off communication with any instance with moderation that does not sufficiently regulate users from stealing or reposting content from ours, violating our users' privacy, or otherwise abusing their ability to interact with our users. We will also immediately block off servers or users with a central dedicated theme of content that would violate our policy.

While we will not necessarily discourage interaction with people from instances with less stringent rules than ours, we recognize that said disparity may, in practice, lead to fundamental differences in said instances' cultures, and that federation and interaction will often lead to unchecked exposure of said cultures to our users and our users to theirs. We will continue to monitor interaction with said instances in order to ensure everything that enters VocaLounge is compliant with our own rules. If we notice a high likelihood of rule-violating content coming in unchecked, we may place various restrictions to slow down interaction with our instance or block media to prevent server storage of media potentially against our rules. If we determine that an instance has a repeat track record of harassment, poses a fundamental danger to our community climate, or threatens the safety of our users, we may, as a last resort, eventually escalate to blocking off communication with the instance entirely.

Our moderation team is dedicated to actively moderating server interactions and ensuring a balance between good communication while not potentially damaging our community health, and is committed to taking action depending on what we consider to be necessary for the safety of our users and our user community. If you have any concerns about the content coming from a particular instance, or concerns about any restrictions we've placed on a particular instance, please let a moderator know so we can look into what can be done.

Other site info

Staff (and who to contact)

  • Follow @staff for updates on the siteâ€™s overall status, and @ambassador if you would like to federate with us.
  • For technical inquiries related to the siteâ€™s functions, contact @Lystrialle or @MystSaphyr. (Our hosting is graciously provided by Masto.host.)
  • For inquiries related to moderation (reports or concerns about content on this site or federating instances), contact @ravnervn, @VocAddict, @ephemeralduet, or @Vocazone.

Credits

  • Instance official icon and banner by @MystSaphyr
  • LGBTQ+ emoji by amethicc

Legal

  • "VOCALOID" is a trademark of Yamaha Corporation.
  • "Singing Vocal Synthesis Tool UTAU" is the copyright of Ameya/Ayame (é£´å±‹ï¼è–è’²).
  • "VOICEROID" is the copyright of AHS Co. Ltd.
  • "CeVIO Creative Studio" is the copyright of CeVIO Project.
  • "Piapro Studio" is the copyright of Crypton Future Media, Inc.
  • "Synthesizer V" is the copyright of Dreamtonics Co., Ltd.
  • "DeepVocal" is the copyright of boxstar.
  • This instance is an unofficial, fan-run endeavor, and does not represent nor claim to represent any of the above entities.
Short: A Mastodon instance specializing in Vocaloid, UTAU, and anything relevant to vocalsynth culture.

Description:
Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, youâ€™re not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.

Tor access

We also offer a way to access mstdn.social via the Tor network with our own .onion URL address.

You can access mstdn.social on Tor via http://ca27gi2fcsvqyi3g25f2baaycshu4ffd2tf4cnnn5nchlfw5xmjjj5id.onion/about

â˜• Coffee networking, back in your cup!

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmicâ€”you decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the community

Since we do not serve ads and we do not sell data we rely on your support. If you like you can donate to help us out a little.

You can help out the community by donating in several ways:

  • Become a Patron
  • Support with PayPal
  • Credit Card Direct
  • Support on LiberaPay
  • Buy us a Ko-Fi

Staff

In addition to the site's owner, @stux Mastodon.Coffee's moderation staff include:

  • @CoffeeGang
  • @catswhocode
  • @GivMeCoffee
  • @freeplay

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Mobile & Desktop Apps

Thanks to Mastodon's open API, you can use it from any of these apps developed by third-party developers.

Android

  • Mastodon for Android - free
  • Tusky - free
  • Subway Tooter - free
  • FediLab - paid

iOS

  • Metatext - free
  • Mastodon for iOS - free
  • Amarok - free
  • Toot! - paid
  • Mast - paid

Web

  • Pinafore - free
  • Halcyon - free
  • Cuckoo - free
  • HyperSpace - free

Desktop

  • Whalebird - free
  • TheDesk - free
  • HyperSpace - free
  • Sengi - free
  • Mastonaut - paid
  • Mast - paid

More from

The Fediverse is more than Mastodon, we not only provide an ethical alternative for social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook but we host also some additional services.

Services

  • mstdn.social - Main Mastodon server
  • Pixelfed - Federated photo sharing
  • Misskey - Federated social network(like Facebook)
  • Matrix + Element - Secure, federated chat
  • AllTube - Download videos from everywhere
  • Lstu - Privacy-friendly URL shortner
  • RSS Bridge - Generate RSS feed from anything

Alternate FE

  • Halcyon - Alternate Mastodon front-end
  • HyperSpace - Alternate Mastodon front-end
  • Invidious - Alternate YouTube front-end
  • Bibliogram - Alternate InstaGram front-end

Server Info

This server is hosted in Falkenstein, Germany at Hetzner.

  • 2 vCPU
  • 4GB Memory
  • 4GB SWAP
  • 40GB Database Disk
  • Wasabi S3 Media Storage
  • Mailgun Email Delivery
  • IPv4: 157.90.115.30
  • IPv6: 2a01:4f8:1c0c:404c::1
  • Tor: ca27gi2fcsvqyi3g25f2baaycshu4ffd2tf4cnnn5nchlfw5xmjjj5id.onion

Server Statistics

  • FediDB.org
  • The-Federation.info
  • Fediverse.Observer

Instance Relays

  • https://federation.stream/inbox
  • https://relay.blob.cat/inbox
  • https://en.relay.friendi.ca/inbox
  • https://relay.k3tan.com/inbox

Attributions

The Mastodon.Coffee source code is hosted on GitHub. You can browse and download the full source code for free. The custom assets, logos and themes are hosted Github. The default theme is a custom Mastodon theme created by @freeplay. The instance banner & thumbnail are edited by @0xd9a.

Hosted by Stuxhost.com.

Contact

You can get in touch with us by sending us a toot via the network or by sending an email:

  • @stux
  • barista@mastodon.coffee
  • dmca@mastodon.coffee

Moderated servers

On Mastodon.Coffee we handle the same blocking / muting list as on mstdn.social. You can find the full list here.
Short: A coffee-purpose, English speaking Mastodon server that runs on coffee.

Description:
This is supposed to be a comfortable place for scientists and journalists to be. Think of it as a cocktail party; behaviors that are unacceptable in that context are unacceptable here.

Patreon for those who wish to support: https://www.patreon.com/sciencemastodon

DMCA agent: Charles Seife (@cgseife, or cgseife at gmail)
Short: A mastodon instance designed primarily for science journalists and scientists. Those who wish to join: to avoid significant delays in accepting your application please let us know your real name, your affiliation, and your area of expertise. Thank you!

Description:
Welcome to VT Social!

NOTE: Please read the "Joining VT Social" section below before applying, or we may reject your application.

VT Social is a fediverse instance for VTubers run by VTubers. Our goal is to provide a space for VTubers and VTuber-adjacent content creators, so we can connect with each other and have a place for fans to discover our content.

About us

VT Social is run by Lina, a tech VTuber with a passion for VTuber technology and empowering everyone to be a VTuber. She spends most of her time working on open source GPU drivers, and also has experience with systems administration. She decided to start this instance to provide a place for all other VTubers to gather together! âœ¨

Our instance is based on the glitch-soc fork of Mastodon, which adds things like better notification controls and the ability to use formatting in posts (our own fork is here and it's based on the Treehouse version, in case you're curious!). Over time, we plan to modify Mastodon to add better tools for VTubers to share their content and allow others to find it.

This instance is hosted on our own hardware at a data center, and we have plans for expanding it and scaling it to be able to host everyone! We know VTubers love to post images and videos, so we are especially committed to having enough storage for all of you, starting with over 10TB of space right off the bat and able to scale up! Right now the instance is still on default settings for upload limits, but we will be optimizing it and customizing it to give everyone better options soon.

The VT Social logo is based on a concept by K.O.D.A., itself inspired by the nullptr::live logo by soundflora*.

Rules and guidelines

Please see our instance rules below for the official policy, but in summary: we want VT Social to be a friendly space for all VTubers free of harassment or abuse. We're all in this together trying to have a good time and connect with fans and supporters, and we hope you are too! Here are a few guidelines to keep in mind:

  • Be friendly with fellow VTubers! Light-hearted rivalry is okay, but don't let it escalate into name-calling or attacks. We all want to coexist together, not fight!
  • Be respectful of others' identities and styles. VTubing gives us the power to be whoever we want to be - embrace it for yourself and for others!
  • Don't discuss the IRL identities of other VTubers, including speculation. This is considered on par with doxxing! Let's respect each others' privacy!
  • Don't sexualize others or make advances on them without consent. Many people aren't comfortable with that!
  • Tag all R18/NSFW content as sensitive, and add a CW if necessary (e.g. gore). Do not direct suggestive/NSFW content at minors, nor involve minors or minor-presenting personas in such content.

This instance allows R18/NSFW images, but all such content must be tagged as sensitive, and you should add CWs as necessary. The line for what counts as NSFW varies by culture, but we expect all content depicting sex acts (censored or not) or genitalia to be marked as such. We recommend that users who frequently post such content enable the "Always mark media as sensitive" option under Preferences â†’ Other, and accounts primarily aimed at an 18+ audience must clearly mention "18+" in the bio. If you repeatedly fail to mark media as sensitive, we will mark your account as enforced-sensitive.

We do reserve the right to use our own judgement in difficult cases, and may ask you to tone it down or remove certain content if we think it is necessary. And although we hope to never have to resort to it, if we ever have to ask someone to leave the instance, we will give them enough time to use the Fediverse migration tools to move their account and followers to another instance.

Joining VT Social

VT Social is open to all VTubers and content creators who work with them! To make sure the people on the instance are genuine creators, we ask that you prove who you are and show that you are an active content creator.

  • If you are a VTuber, you need to have at least 2 stream VODs or videos using your avatar (2D, 3D, PNG) totaling at least 1 hour of content.
  • If you are a VTuber-related content creator or illustrator, you need to have created official content/illustration work for one or more VTubers at least two times, or be actively involved in a VTuber-centric creation or development project. VTuber managers are also welcome.
  • Illustrators with a focus on VTuber fanart are also welcome, as long as it is a significant part of your work and welcome by the VTubers you draw (memes don't count!).

These are not hard rules, and we are open to being flexible as long as you are part of the VTubing community!

In order to prove that you are who you say you are, please add your desired username (@someone@vt.social) to a website or social media page you control, and link it when you request an account on the instance (bio, tweets, subpages, posts, files on a domain, etc. are all fine). When you request an account, please tell us:

  • A little bit about yourself and what you do (just one sentence or two is enough)
  • A link to your verification post/page (you need to mention your VT Social username there!)
  • A link to your existing content
  • If you are a manager or otherwise associated with a VTuber, a link that we can use to verify your relationship

Please post a tweet or make mention of your application on your socials, so we can verify who you are! Something like "I'm joining VT Social at @myusername@vt.social", or even just "I'm applying for a VT Social account!" if you use the same username on both sites is all we need. You can also add your @myusername@vt.social ID to your bio instead. Please link to the post/tweet/bio when you apply, and tell us what you did if it's not obvious, so we can verify you quickly! This helps us make sure the person creating the account is not an imposter claiming to be you.

What if I'm just getting started and I don't have any content yet?

No worries! You can sign up on any other instance, and then, once you have some content, move to VT Social! Mastodon and the Fediverse allow you to move your account over and bring all your old followers, and make sure anyone who lands on your old account gets redirected to your new one.

What about fans?

Thanks to the awesomeness of the fediverse, you can connect with fans hosted on any other instance! We want to focus on the content creators themselves, so that we can help fans discover their content and find new VTubers to follow all in one place, as well as connect together VTubers and artists, modelers, riggers, and more. We think we can do a better job by working to make the best instance for creators, instead of having a general-purpose instance where anyone can sign up.

Federation policy

VT Social federates with everyone by default, and we only preemptively defederate instances in egregious cases (e.g. instances run by known serial harassers or openly hosting and condoning hate groups). However, we do expect all instances to have basic moderation and rules forbidding harassment. If we receive multiple reports from users of an instance, and it does not appear to have such rules nor be moderated appropriately, we will defederate it in order to protect our users. If you admin such an instance and have corrected the situation, please email lina@asahilina.net in order to request to have federation reinstated.

Content legality and CWs

VT Social is hosted in Japan and subject to Japanese law. We recognize that there are certain classes of content on other instances which many users may not wish to see, and which may vary in legality in other countries. For instances which host large amounts of such content without the appropriate CWs or sensitive tags, we may use media restrictions to effectively mark such media as sensitive in public timelines. We plan to work on our own improvements to Mastodon in the future, to provide finer-grained controls so that we can ensure we don't create unnecessary divisions between communities while empowering our users to decide what kinds of content they wish to see, and balance their own risk of exposure to unwanted content. At VT Social, we expect our own users to use sensitive tags and CWs appropriately, and have stricter policies for content on the instance as mentioned above.
Short: The biggest VTuber instance, by VTubers for VTubers and adjacent content creators.

Description: Pixelfed is an image sharing platform, an ethical alternative to centralized platforms.
Short: Pixelfed is an image sharing platform, an ethical alternative to centralized platforms.

Description:
Hypnosis

HypnoGuys is a Mastodon server focused on guys who are into hypnosis, including (but not limited to) erotic applications. This is also commonly known as "erotic hypnosis" or "hypnokink". You do not have to be interested in hypnosis to join this server, but you must understand and accept that hypnosis is the theme of this server.

Gendered Space

HypnoGuys is a gendered space: as the name implies, this server is focused on guys. People of all genders and sexualities are allowed to use this server, as long as they understand that "guys" are the focus here. If you are looking for a Mastodon server focused on hypnosis without this focus on guys, Triggerphrase is an excellent option.

Note that sex and gender discrimination is not allowed on this server. Despite being a gendered space, HypnoGuys does not put down people who are not guys.

Content Warnings (CW)

Mastodon provides a "content warning" feature, where users can gate their posts behind a short piece of text, warning potential readers of what they are about to encounter. Content warnings (or CWs) must be used for content that involves explicit sex, such as fucking.

However, not all erotic content requires a CW on this server. Generally speaking, we follow the example set by the popular woof.group Mastodon server: anything that you might see in a leather bar is perfectly acceptable and does not require a content warning. Flirting, groping, jockstraps, boobs, butts, moderate impact, pup gear: no CW necessary. If you'd take it to the back bar or the playroom, use a CW. Genitals, piss, fucking, fisting, piercing, scat: CW please.

Check out the documentation for woof.group to see more about this policy.

Banned content

You may not post the following content on HypnoGuys:

  • Sexual content involving minors, including artistic depictions
  • Gore and extremely graphic violence, including artistic depictions
  • National Socialism
  • Nazism
  • Holocaust denial
  • Racism
  • Alt right, including under the disguise of freedom of speech
  • Gender-critical
  • Sex and gender discrimination
  • Transphobia
  • Misogyny
  • Pro-ana / Pro-mia

Banned activities

You may not engage in any of the following activities on HypnoGuys:

  • Automated sharing of third-party content, news sources, websites or social media content that doesnâ€™t belong to you
  • Repeated trolling, insulting or derogatory comments towards others, even after they ask you to stop
  • Mass following and aggregation of content

Approved content

As long as you don't violate any of the above rules, you may post any content you want on HypnoGuys, whether related to hypnosis or not. In addition, here are some examples that are explicitly approved, and do belong on this server:

  • Discussions of hypnosis, including hypnotherapy and erotic hypnosis
  • Media related to hypnosis (such as spirals, art, photo manipulations, audio, video, etc) that you own, or that the owner has provided written permission for you to post
  • Advertising professional services related to hypnosis
  • Explicit sexual content, with an appropriate content warning
Short: A social network for guys who are into hypnosis.

Description:
This instance is focused on Drupal, free and open source software, and web development, but any content is welcome as long as it adheres to the Drupal Code of Conduct.

https://www.drupal.org/dcoc

You and/or your employer can give back to the Drupal project by helping us to keep the servers online with your donations.

https://opencollective.com/drupal-mastodon

Drupal is a registered trademark of Dries Buytaert.
Short: Mastodon instance focused on the Drupal CMS.

Description: Just another Pleroma site ~
Part of the https://opendesktop.org network!

Babka Social is a Mastodon instance for the Jews and Jewish allies from around the world. We are values oriented (see https://blog.babka.social/values ) and see our goal as making a safe, supportive space for Jews to live full, authentic lives online.

We welcome diversity and are welcome to LGBTQ+ Jews, Queer Jews, Jews of Color, Converts, Disabled Jews, and others from around the world. We are openly welcoming to those who do not identify as Jewish but are either Jewish adjacent or are allies of the Jewish community.

A fuller explanation of our server rules can be found at https://blog.babka.social/rules
Short: A site where you can be unapologetically Jewish, with a healthy, diverse community of Jews and Jewish allies.

Description:
A friendly space for neurodifferent folks.

This space is designed for ND (dx, self-id/dx, or questioning) folks to find each other and connect in a space that is welcoming.

Please read the rules.

About the server

Who is welcome on Neurodifferent.me?

This space is designed for ND folks to find each other and connect in a safe space that is welcoming.

We support self-identification/diagnosis as these are often inaccessible due to cost, biases and other factors. Questioning people are welcome. Many of us found our way to diagnosis by seeing ourselves reflected back through others experiences.

Note: We are an intersectional space, and just because one may not personally share an experience someone else does, does not give us the right to silence or invalidate others voicing of their own experiences, even if it makes us uncomfortable.

Content Warnings

Content Warnings (CW) are an integrated part of mastodon, and provide a method for people to choose to protect topics that may be sensitive. If you feel that something may be sensitive, or spoil someone's experience (eg. sharing about a TV show), you are encouraged to post using a CW.

Note: Users will not request other users to suppress aspects of their intersectional identities, and related experiences, behind a CW. No user should have to suppress their own identity in order to avoid complaints, reports or harassment by others.

Note: There is a setting in your preferences to open all posts with Content Warnings automatically, if you don't want to click through each one.

Image descriptions

It is an expectation of this instance that you add accurate descriptions to images and video that you post to aid in accessibility. (A description like "image.jpg" that does not aid in accessibility would not meet this expectation.)

If you post an image of a screenshot of text, it is an expectation of this instance that you transcribe the text in the image description.

It is the responsibility of all users to remind each other about descriptive text, so that this is an accessible space for all.

Behaviours that may result in a ban

Racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, queerphobia, able-ism, etc. (may result in a permanent ban, you may not receive a prior warning)

Misuse of reporting mechanisms to target marginalized individuals.

Serious dishonesty that is hurtful to others.

Impersonating other people.

Harassment of any kind.

Accounts that automatically repeat a Twitter account, RSS feed, etc. must post as Unlisted, not Public.

Abuse / Weaponization of moderation/reporting

Do not attempt to weaponize our anti-abuse/reporting tools/policies against other marginalized groups.

We are an intersectional space, and just because we may not personally share an experience someone else does, does not give us the right to silence or invalidate others voicing of their own experiences, even if it makes us uncomfortable.

Attempts to re-centre discussions of marginalized people around the feelings of the privileged will be taken as manipulative behaviour undertaken in bad-faith. (E.g. white people should not demand that Black people put CW's on every discussion of race or a straight person who reports a queer person for writing "I dislike straight people".)

Migrating from another instance

Create a new account on the server (neurodifferent.me).

On the new account:

  • Go to preferences -> Moving from a different account.
  • Enter the handle of the old account.
  • Click Create alias.

On your existing account:

  • Go to preferences -> import/export -> data export
  • Download the CSV file called "Follows"
  • Go to preferences -> account -> Move to a different account.
  • Enter the handle of the new account, and current account password.
  • Click Move Followers.

On the new account:

  • Go to preferences -> import/export -> data import.
  • Choose the follows file you downloaded previously.
  • Click Upload.

It will potentially take a little while for all followers to migrate across.

Any questions, please reach out to @squish@neurodifferent.me.
Short: A friendly space for neurodifferent folks.

Description:
A Mastodon server for Greater Boston/Massachusetts/New England folks interested in a more inclusive, sustainable, and equitable region.

Many members come from transportation equity and policy backgrounds. While this server is for everyone, there may be a lot of local talk about those topics!

If you wish migrate your account, instead of simply making a new account, use this page as a resource and follow these steps:

  1. Back up your account data
  2. Make a new account on this server (check your spam for the confirmation email!)
  3. Alias your old account to the new account by creating an alias on this server
  4. Move your followers by using the "Move to a different account" function on your old server.
  5. Upload your following list to the new account

Please note that posts are not moved when you move servers; this is due to technical limitations.

Server Status and Funding

This instance is currently running on a server donated by @flyyn - your friendly local devops masshole who's currently between jobs.

The server will likely need to be tuned and upgraded as members join.

Please consider donating to keep things running smoothly! We have a Ko-Fi page set up to collect funds.

Registration

This server has a generally open registration policy, for anyone who agrees to abide by our rules.

At times, we may require approval for new members, to ensure safety and technical stability. We will process registrations as quickly as feasible.

Username Tip - we are in a world of federated servers. Usernames must be unique '@better.boston', but you will be sharing space with other servers.

You may wish to choose something that stands out, similar to a Twitter username. Sure, '@bones@better.boston' is (currently) available, but conversations with '@bones@mastodon.social' will get confusing fast!

Volunteers

This Mastodon instance is administered by Matthew, who also conceptualized it.

Technical operation and hosting by Flyyn.

Moderation Policy

We actively moderate this server; this is not a "free-speech zone".

However, while we are dedicated to moderation, our labor is on a volunteer basis and we cannot see everything.

If you find any objectionable material on this server or elsewhere, please report the content so we can take appropriate action.

Credit

Banner edited by Flyyn, using Mastadon graphics and "Boston skyline from the BU Bridge on Head of the Charles Regatta Weekend" by Bill Damon, CC BY 2.0
Short: A server for people in Greater Boston and Massachusetts interested in a more inclusive, equitable, and sustainable region.

Description: This is the personal Mastodon server of Ben, AI6YR. Friends and friends of friends welcome (I personally approve everyone who joins here, so it might take some time!). If you're in the Conejo Valley (and promise to abide by the rules), I'll approve you; if you're involved in responding to disasters and emergencies, you are welcome; all of my Patreon supporters; refugees from the bird site who used to follow me; and friends of all of the above. Costs of running this server are covered by those who subscribe to my Patreon at https://www.patreon.com/ai6yr - thanks to all! Include who referred you to my server if you are applying for an account!

Description:
Sauropods.win is a Mastodon server that has accreted various scientists, artists, and enthusiasts in the area of palaeobiology and zoology. It is an informal place, and may contain ridiculous and completely off-topic conversation.

Sauropods.win is for anyone that can stand a local timeline full of nerdy palaeontology / zoology / arty talk, and who just wants somewhere nice to hang out on the internet.

Social media is at its best when it creates spaces where people can feel comfortable enough to collaborate, share, offer mutual support and just have fun. The core of this community are artists who bring the world of the past to life. So, please also respect the work of artists by asking for permission and using attribution whenever possible. Image descriptions are strongly encouraged (and will make your work more popular.)

If you encounter an obvious troll or anyone breaking the server rules please report it (even if you arenâ€™t the target.) If you are uncertain, report it and leave a clear note about why you are uncertain.

Moderators may offer a warning or ban immediately depending on the severity or pattern of infractions.

You can help financially support Sauropods.win at Open Collective
Short: A Mastodon instance for sauropod appreciators everywhere.

Description:
About AkademieNL

This is a voluntary run, not-for-profit server that is meant for anyone working in, affiliated with, or with a general interest in Dutch academia (#AkademieNL). We welcome anyone working at, or that has worked at one of the Dutch universities, knowledge or research institutions, people working on science policies and funding, science journalists, and anyone with a general interest in Dutch academia.
We offer an inclusive safe haven where academics and likeminded individuals can converse in a constructive manner, while also offering space for digital banter (e.g. memes) and leisure (e.g. pics of cats or dogs, holidays, etc.).

Code of Conduct

First and foremost: follow the above mentioned Server Rules at all times.
Roughly speaking, toots can be divided in to two categories: scientific and non-scientific. Both are subject to the Server Rules, but for scientific toots it is also expected that they uphold scientific standards and do not harm scientific integrity in any way. As such, moderation on scientific toots has a more strict policy.
Being an user on AkademieNL is a privilege, not a right. Moderators and administrators can revoke this privilege if the Server Rules or Code of Conduct are violated.

Privacy & security

All data for the AkademieNL-server are located in France. It uses a TSL (Transport Layer Security) for encryption and by doing so ensuring that the data is safe. Backups are made daily.
For some actions, such as when someone signs up, a notification mail needs to be send to the moderator. This mail is handled securely through a SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) and is directed towards AkademieNL@pm.me. This e-mail is provided by Protonmail where everything is stored fully encrypted as well.
We advise you to further protect your account by enabling 2FA (2-factor authentication).

Migrating to AkademieNL

If you don't have a Mastodon account yet, you can simply make one here and start enjoying the #AkademieNL fediverse. If you already have an account, you will need to migrate it.

Step one

Create a new account through the AkademieNL hompepage.

Step two

Once your new account has been approved, click preferences -> account -> create an account alias (under moving from a different account). Once there fill in your old account. Your old account will be linked as an alias to the new account.

Step three

Once your new account has the old account as an alias, go to your old account and once again click preferences -> account, but now click configure it here (under move to a different account). Once there fill in the handle of your new AkademieNL-account and the password to your old account. Once you click move followers, your old account will be migrated to the new one. This process might take a while, depending on the speed of the old server.
Short: This server is meant for anyone working in, affiliated with, or with a general interest in Dutch academia (#AkademieNL).

Welcome to the OpenSocial friendica node. 
We want to offer you a stable and fast communication platform - away from the big data octopuses. This node is open for everyone who wants to have a look into the "Fediverse". We respect your privacy and do our best to make it as easy as possible for you to get started.

No ads. No tracking.
Instance is hosted in Germany.
Your data is safe.

We want to offer you a stable and fast communication platform - away from the big data octopuses. This node is open for everyone who wants to have a look into the "Fediverse". We respect your privacy and do our best to make it as easy as possible for you to get started.
