Description:
Creating community with accountability

Similar to INCITE!'s community accountability statement, we believe in community accountability, a process in which we work together to:

  1. create and affirm values and practices that resist abuse and oppression, and encourage safety, support, and accountability
  2. provide safety and support to our community members through moderation

Notifications of Claimed Infringement

If you believe that someone on masto.yttrx.com has violated your copyright, you may send us a Notification of Copyright Infringement. For us to process such a notification, it must substantially comply with the requirements set forth in United States law. To speed up our handling of your notification, please make sure it complies with the following criteria:

Notifications may be submitted to masto.yttrx.com's Registered Agent via email (no attachments, please) to abuse@masto.yttrx.com

  • An electronic signature (PGP) of a person authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.
  • Identification of the copyrighted work claimed to have been infringed, or, if multiple copyrighted works at a single online site are covered by a single notification, a representative list of such works at that site.
  • Identification of the material that is claimed to be infringing or to be the subject of infringing activity and that is to be removed or access to which is to be disabled, and information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to locate the material.
  • Information reasonably sufficient to permit the service provider to contact the complaining party, such as an address, telephone number, and, if available, an electronic mail address at which the complaining party may be contacted.
  • A statement that the complaining party has a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law.
  • A statement that the information in the notification is accurate, and under penalty of perjury, that the complaining party is authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed.

MastodonAdmin.IO account
Short: A community of Mastodon enthusiasts run by friends

Description:
In signing up with Pieville, I understand and accept that I can be banned at any time for any reason by management, and I agree to take full responsibility for my posts.

For truly private data sent between two people, Mastodon offers no End-to-End encryption. Please find your own private communication methods if needed.

Welcome to NorCal.Social!

This is a Mastodon instance specifically intended for anyone who lives in or has a connection to Northern California.

Getting Started

After you sign up be sure to check for a confirmation email. You have to verify your email address before we can activate your account.

If you are new to Mastodon check out info.norcal.social for some general information on getting started and links to Mastodon documentation.

Contributing

norcal.social is run entirely by volunteers. However hosting requires real world costs. Contributing is always optional and any donations you make here go entirely to hosting fees: opencollective.com/norcalsocial

Rules

In addition to the Server rules listed below NorCal.Social adheres to the Mastodon Server Covenant.

Please report any rule violations or spam you see and a moderator will take appropriate action.

Thanks for being part of NorCal.Social!
Short: Welcome to NorCal.social! This is a Mastodon instance specifically intended for  anyone who lives in or has a connection to Northern California. All are welcome, join today :)

Description:
General Information

Mastodon instance for furries of the larger, tubbier persuasion. Generally focused on fatfur and related content, while also just being a place to post whatever you want (within reason naturally).

In an attempt to curb spam accounts the site has been set to require approval for registration. These will be reviewed ASAP.

This is a federated server and is relayed to several other furry Mastodon instances.

Any servers reported as abusive/trolling will be blocked to maintain stability of this instance.

Moderation Team

Wobbl.xyz is moderated by:

  • @tarrien - Admin/Owner
  • @thesammon - Moderator
  • @SnowBlueHusky - Moderator

Content Warnings

Mastodon/Wobbl.xyz does not force the use of content warnings (CWs); however, using them is a cultural norm of the platform. On Mastodon, the words "content warning" don't automatically mean that a post is NSFW and they're not synonymous with "trigger warning." They're just tags which tell people what kind of content is in a post, and they can be better thought of as "spoilers" or "content notices." Mastodon also allows users to filter posts on keywords contained in CWs to avoid certain content, and it indexes CWs for searching. The goal of CWs is to prevent surprises and make posts easier to discover.

Posts from Wobbl.xyz are sent to other federated instances through boosts and the Federated Timeline. An excess of posts without CWs or with vague CWs may cause other instances to defederate (block) us, so please use CWs where appropriate.

Here are some content warning tags that you can use as a starting point:

  • SFW, NSFW

  • Body types like: Fat / Fat Fur, Muscles / Muscular, Thin

  • Sizes like: Blob, Immobile, Hyper

  • Kinks like: Healthplay, Slob, Sweat, Weight Gain, Transformation, etc.

  • Nudity / Genitals (and additional specifics like Bulge, Vagina, Penis, etc.)

  • Furry Art, IRL, Belly Photo, Gainer Talk

Example Content Warning: Furry Art, Fat Fur, SFW

We also ask that posts seeking financial help or donations (such as GoFundMe campaigns) are tagged with the content warning Financial Aid Request or Mutual Aid Request.

This is not an exhaustive list. Fun/silly tagging is allowed and so are other tags not listed above; we just request that you are descriptive about the contents of your posts and be mindful of people who use filters.

AI Art

Wobbl does not allow the posting of AI generated art.

We define AI art as art that is fully or primarily generated by a neural network AI art generator (i.e. DALL-E).

The reason we are choosing to ban AI art is because these platforms generally use scraped art assets and images for their data models without proper copyright attribution or compensation to the original artists. We polled the Wobbl community and received a large response in favor of the ban.

The Wobbl team considers the current iteration of these platforms as theft and plagiarism of copyrighted works of artists, and currently there does not appear to be a way to mitigate this glaring issue. We value the importance of artists in the furry community and choose to support them against this major threat. As technology is always changing, this policy will be updated as necessary.

Notes

  • Our moderation approach for AI art will be to ask the poster to remove it themselves. If further action is needed, we will keep record of such. Multiple infractions without cooperation with the moderation team may lead to suspension.

  • We cannot police the posts of other instances when it comes to things like this. Please don't report posts from other instances with AI art to us.

  • We do not consider the use of AI tools in the creation of art to be an issue (i.e. artists using tools to generate backgrounds, fill spaces, etc.). This ban applies to art that is primarily/completely generated by AI models.

  • As with any other rule or policy, we ask our members to refrain from going after those who do post AI art. If you see it posted to Wobbl, feel free to report it, but there is no reason to demonize people. Doing so is against Rule #5.

  • We understand there is value to AI generated art, the technology does have benefits. We apologize to those who may be impacted by this policy decision, however we refuse to host such content.

Impersonation and Art Theft

If you believe a Wobbl member is impersonating you or uploading your art without permission, please report this to the Wobbl mods using the on-platform Report function. If you do not have a Wobbl account, please email admin@wobbl.xyz with your concerns and we'll investigate. Follow-up steps may require contact off-platform to verify information as best we can.

Because it would be impossible for Wobbl mods to proactively verify the "true furry identity" of every user on Wobbl, please understand that we strongly prefer that the impersonated person or artist to contact us DIRECTLY (through a report or email) rather than have someone report the art/impersonation on their behalf. We cannot, out-of-the-blue, proactively reach out to each and every impersonated person or artist to ask for more details.

FAQ

  • CW Policy FAQs
    • "Why is my topic not listed?"
      • This is a short list of tags most common for this instance, it is not exhaustive. Please feel free to use any other tags that you feel are appropriate to your post.
    • "XYZ shouldn't have to come with a warning, why is it on there?"
      • Please keep in mind that these are for describing and tagging your content more than "warning" about it, this allows users here and elsewhere to view what they specifically want to more easily and filter out what they don't.
    • "What if I don't want to use CWs?"
      • Wobbl.xyz and Mastodon in general don't require CWs, however they are expected and appreciated. If you would rather not tag your posts at all, one option is to change your default posting privacy setting to "Unlisted", so your posts don't get pushed directly to the global timeline.
    • "What if I see a post from Wobbl.xyz that isn't properly tagged?"
      • Please keep in mind this is a community, and behind each user is a person. If you want to civilly and kindly point it out to them, there's nothing wrong with that. If you are not able to do so for whatever reason, or would rather not, you may report the post and the site's admin team will investigate instead. Otherwise you are always free to mute/block them and move on.
    • "What if I see a post from a different instance that isn't properly tagged?"
      • If it bothers you, mute/block and move on. We are all adults on this instance (per the rules), and should be able to compose ourselves as such.
  • General Instance FAQs
    • "What does it mean when you say you're "federated with multiple furry servers"?"
      • Mastodon allows servers to connect to each other so we can interact with people on multiple servers. Federating with furry servers means we have it set up where the public posts from those servers we're connected to, as well as public posts from Wobbl.xyz, all go into a shared "Federated" feed.
    • "Who can I reach out to for assistance?"
      • Anybody listed under the Administered By: section above can assist.
    • "Do I have to sign up to Wobbl.xyz to be able to interact with people on this instance?"
      • No! As long as you have a Mastodon account on a server that we haven't blocked for some reason, or haven't blocked us, you should be able to interact.
    • "If this is just some small community space, what's stopping you from suddenly disappearing and shutting down one day?"
      • Sadly, very little, however Wobbl.xyz has made a committment to offer at least a 30-day warning if we do choose to shut down for some reason.

Donations

The instance is, and will remain, free to use. If you would like to, feel free to help support the instance's upkeep! Any donations go directly to funding the site.

Ko-Fi Patreon

The instance's costs and infrastructure information can be found at @transparency

Attributions

Utilizing the Modern theme from this Git page.

For emoji, this instance uses:

Mutant Standard emoji and Dragn-Emoji - Licensed under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 International License.

Blobhaj emoji

Blobfox by @volpeon@mk.vulpes.one - Licensed under Apache 2.0

Description:
About this Server

Digital Security on Mastodon: Advice for those in conflict zones or other high-risk areas:

When using Mastodon in conflict zones or other high-risk areas, it is particularly important to be aware of how you can protect your account and digital information. While every situation is different, you can improve the general security of your Mastodon account and manage its visibility in a few steps. Navigating account settings is critical for human rights activists, journalists and others facing digital security threats. With the evolving situation in Ukraine.

  • You can review your post and account visibility under account settings
  • Read more on post and account visibility here

Social networking, back in your hands

Sharing your thoughts has never been more convenient. Publish anything you want: links, pictures, text, video. All on a platform that is community-owned and ad-free.

You have 500 characters. You can adjust the thumbnails of your pictures with focal points. You can use custom emojis, hide things behind spoiler warnings and choose who sees a given post. Messed it up? You can delete & redraft for quick corrections.

Without an incentive to sell you things, Mastodon allows you to consume content you enjoy uninterrupted. Your feed is chronological, ad-free and non-algorithmicâ€”you decide who you want to see!

Be sure to check our Terms & Code of Conduct.

Support the community

If you like you can donate to help the core Mastodon project out at Mastodon Sponsors

Staff

SEOCommunity.social's admin and moderation staff include:

  • Natalie Slater
  • Simon Cox
  • Jess Joyce
  • JR Oakes

Cross-posting

"Cross-posting" is the automatic copying of posts from one platform to another. That definition does not include the simultaneous posting to multiple platforms from the same app, such as Twidere or PostyBirb. If you use those apps, we consider those posts original, and the following need not apply.

Cross-posting from Mastodon to other platforms is fully permitted. Cross-posting into Mastodon from another platform is permitted under the following terms:

  1. The posts do not include platform-specific references, e.g. talking about "here" meaning Twitter, or including text from other non-Mastodon users verbatim (e.g. cross-posted quote tweets)
  2. The account is at least semi-regularly monitored by the author, so that interactions from Mastodon users are not ignored
  3. The account being cross-posted is owned by the same person. Third-party copying of content is not permitted

Server Info

Location

This server is hosted in Amsterdam by the wonderful team at Ahrefs.

Server Blocks

We are currently blocking other servers found in the official list from Mastodon. Our list may not always be up-to-date from the official version, but that is our goal. If you find harmful or illegal content in your timeline from another domain, please let an admin know.

Server Statistics

  • FediDB.org
  • The-Federation.info
  • Fediverse.Observer

Attributions

The seocommunity.social source code is hosted on GitHub. You can browse and download the full source code here. The instance mascot is designed by @TheCanine.

What to do about self-harm and suicide concerns on Mastodon

If you or someone you know is struggling or in crisis, youâ€™re not alone. Use the contact info below to get help.

  • United States: Contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-TALK (8255). Crisis workers are available 24 hours a day. Calls are free and confidential.
  • Other countries & regions: To find a crisis center near you, visit International Association for Suicide Prevention.

If you or someone you know is thinking about engaging in self-harm or suicidal behavior, you should seek help as soon as possible by contacting services with expertise in crisis intervention and suicide prevention.
Short: Mastodon server for the SEO (Search Engine Optimization) Community.

Description:
h-net.social is a Mastodon community hosted by H-Net: Humanities and Social Sciences Online. We hope to build a community of humanities and social science scholars committed to civil discourse and academic best practices.


H-Net's Mastodon instance will always be free and open for users.


As the server grows, however, so will our technological needs and associated costs. We are a 501(c)(3) academic non-profit, so we do appreciate support from those who benefit from our services.


You can make a tax-deductible contribution to support the server here:


https://donorbox.org/h-net-mastodon-server-support
Short: H-Net Humanities and Social Sciences Online

Description:
sona (About)

kulupu ni pi ilo Masoton li tawa toki pona. ona li tawa jan pi sona lili tawa jan pi sona mute. o toki e ijo pi toki pona, anu toki kepeken toki pona. sina wile e ijo tawa kulupu la o toki tawa admin@toki.social.
This is a Mastodon community for toki pona. It is a community for beginners and experienced speakers. Please talk in toki pona or about toki pona. If you want to give suggestions, message @admin@toki.social.

pana (Donate)

o pana e mani tawa kulupu ni
Support the running of the instance's infrastructure financially

https://ko-fi.com/tokisocial
https://www.patreon.com/tokisocial

lawa (Basic Rules)

  • o toki utala ala.
    No hate speech/discrimination/etc.
  • o pana ala e toki jaki.
    No spam.
  • o pana ala e ijo unpa.
    No NSFW content.
  • o pona tawa jan ante.
    Show respect.

sina pali e ike suli ni la mi weka e sina lon tenpo ale kepeken tenpo lili (Instantly Bannable Offenses)

  • pali sina li ike li ken ala lon lawa pi ma Mewika (tan ni: ilo mi li lon ma Mewika).
    Posting content deemed illegal under US law (where our servers are located).
  • pali sina li ike suli li utala suli tawa jan pi sona nasin ante.
    Extreme bigotry.
  • pali sina li ike tawa jan, taso sina awen pali e ni.
    Harassment.
  • jan li len e sona, taso sina pana e sona len ni.
    Doxxing.
  • sina pana e sitelen jaki utala e sitelen jaki pi insa sijelo.
    Posting gore/graphic violence.

sitelen (Fonts)

sitelen pilin laso li tan jan Lectronice. The sitelen pilin laso font was created by Lectronice.
Short: toki! ni li kulupu pi toki pona lon ilo Masoton. o kama!

Description:
This Mastodon server is located in France.
We will not federate or relay with hate groups.
Server is self moderated by the community. Moderation is an impossible job with no winners. Please respect our moderators. And if you are a moderator, please respect all users. Moderate with a light touch.
Treat others here as if you were speaking face to face. If you wouldn't say something to someone in-person then don't say it here.

Description:
archaeo.social is a Mastodon instance for archaeologists, ancient historians and anyone interested in scholarly communication about the human past. It is part of the archaeo.social collective, a network of open, federated social media services for archaeology.

This server is administrated by Joe Roe and financially supported by donations on OpenCollective. Our policies, rules and community expectations are decided by consensus; discussion takes place in our GitHub repositories and are open to all.

Joining archaeo.social

Creating an account on archaeo.social means that it will be your "home server" in the Mastodon network. Your posts will by default appear in our local timeline and you will need to agree to abide by our rules and community expectations. It doesn't mean that you are limited to interacting here; you can follow users from other Mastodon servers and the wider Fediverse freely, and your personal timeline will include only the accounts and hashtags you follow, wherever they are.

After you have created an account, uploaded a profile picture, and filled in your bio, we strongly recommend introducing yourself to the archaeo.social community with a post that tells us about yourself and your interests. Including the hashtag #introduction will greatly increases how many potential new followers your post reaches.

archaeo.social is still a young community and the Fediverse in general is not as widely used in academia as other social networks. We appreciate anything you can do to spread awareness, for example by including links to your Mastodon profile (i.e. https://archaeo.social/@username; the short form username@archaeo.social only works in the Fediverse) on your other social media profiles, on your institutional profile, in your next conference presentation, etc.

Community expectations

These guidelines supplement the server's rules.

Zero tolerance

archaeo.social has zero tolerance for racism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, ableism, and casteism. Users that engage in these behaviours will have their accounts immediately and permanently suspended.

Acceptable and unacceptable content

archaeo.social is primarily intended for scholarly communication about archaeology and the human past. We encourage you to use it to talk about your research, promote academic events and programmes, share references and resources, and network with colleagues. We are an international community, and posts can be in any language. Satire, activism, and a reasonable amount of "off-topic" posting are also welcome. Users who use our services excessively for other purposes may have their accounts frozen and will be asked to migrate their accounts to a more suitable server.

Content that others may not wish to see should be accompanied with a content warning and/or marked as sensitive. This includes, but is not limited to:

  • Images of human remains
  • Spoilers for recent popular media
  • Content likely to be of interest to only very narrow audience

Users who repeatedly omit these warnings may have their posts marked as sensitive automatically, have their accounts frozen, or be suspended.

The following types of content are not allowed on this server:

  • Pornographic or sexually explicit media without an explicit historical context
  • Excessively violent media without an explicit historical context
  • Anything illegal in Germany, including Holocaust denial and Nazi symbolism
  • Advertising and spam

Users that post these types of content will be immediately suspended.

Academic integrity

Behaviour that is broadly considered unacceptable in academia is also unacceptable on archaeo.social. This includes, but is not limited to, academic dishonesty (plagiarism, cheating, not giving credit), misrepresentation (of your credentials, experience, background), spreading misinformation or pseudoscience, and soliciting for predatory publishers or conferences. Users that engage in or promote these behaviours may have their accounts frozen or suspended.

Etiquette and accessibility

When posting, please be considerate of how your posts will appear both to your followers and in the local and federated timelines. Consider using a content warning or making the post unlisted if it is significantly 'off-topic' (i.e. likely not of interest to most other users of archaeo.social) When writing a thread, set the first post to be "public" and subsequent posts "unlisted", so that they do not flood the timeline.

To make posts accessible to all users, attached media should be accompanied with a description. A good media description concisely summarises the content and purpose of the image or video. It shouldn't be longer than a sentence or two. An exception is if you post an image of running text; you should transcribe the text in full in the image description.

Bots and organisation accounts

archaeo.social was made for people and prioritises the experience of human users.

Bots are currently not restricted on archaeo.social, but we ask operators of bots to be considerate of other users, server resources, and the readability of our local timeline. Specifically, bot accounts should:

  • Include the name and contact details of the human being responsible for them in their bio
  • Respond to direct messages from server administrators and moderators
  • Not post at a rate that dominates the local timeline or degrades server performance

Accounts that represent commercial, institutional, or collective entities are also allowed, but must be relevant to the server's scope.

Reporting and moderation

archaeo.social's moderation team actively monitor the local timeline. Unlisted posts are not proactively reviewed but are subject to the same rules and expectations.

If you see a user of archaeo.social breaking any of our rules or failing to meet any of the above expectations, please report the problematic content to moderators. Please explain why you are reporting them in as much detail as you can; we aim to respond within 24 hours.

You can also report posts you see from users of federated servers on archaeo.social, but please be aware the we are more limited in the ways we can respond to them. Mastodon has extensive options for controlling what you see from users on your home and federated servers.

Privacy, data security and longevity

Mastodon was not designed to be a secure storage or messaging protocol. Everything you post to this server, including direct messages to other users, is stored unencrypted and therefore technically readable by anyone with access to the database. We will never knowingly breach your privacy or leave your personal data vulnerable to misuse, but can make no guarantees. Please see the privacy policy for more details.

We envisage archaeo.social as a long-term resource for the scholarly community in archaeology and related disciplines. All posts and uploaded media are backed up, at least daily, to multiple secure locations. However, archaeo.social is not an archive and you should not assume that your data will be preserved in perpetuity. In the event that circumstances force the server to shut down, we commit to giving users at least three months notice so that they can export their data and migrate their account to another server.
Short: archaeo.social is a Mastodon instance for archaeologists, ancient historians and anyone interested in scholarly communication about the human past. More: https://about.archaeo.social

Description:
*.zeroes.ca code of conduct

who, what, when, where, why

zeroes.ca is a COVID-aware community built on Mastodon and connected to the fediverse. We opened our doors for the first time on April 27th, 2022. We're hosted on servers in Canada, operated by admins who live in Canada, and open to people from anywhere in the world. We are not a commercial website; we have no financial interest in your data or activity. This is a volunteer-run, voluntary service. We're here for dissemination of science, experiences, information, and ideas; conversation and discussions; questions and answers -- a safe, good faith space for any and all COVID-related topics. Misinfo, disinfo, and other unlawful, harmful, and/or bad faith content is not permitted.

software

We run vanilla Mastodon with some custom tweaks (5k character limit, 6 poll questions, BirdUI/Tangerine themes), as well as Matrix (Element/Synapse), WriteFreely, and PixelFed instances that can be used via OAuth. Authenticated Fetch is enabled, "AI" bots and other scrapers are set to 'disallow' in robots.txt, and we do not federate with Threads/Meta.

moderation

Our goal is to provide an environment conducive to community and communication and hostile to anything unlawful, malicious, and/or synonymous with bullying. We reserve the right to remove any accounts, content, or federated servers that are detrimental to this community and the above goal. We realize you're human and we are too, so we'll do our best to be fair yet protective. If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to admins/mods.

reporting

When reporting accounts, please include posts that show rule-breaking behaviour (when applicable) and detailed context in the comment/note, so as to help us fully understand the situation and take appropriate action. This is especially important when the content is in a language in which the moderation is not fluent. We endeavour to handle all reports within 24 hours. Bear in mind that you are not notified of punitive actions pursuant to any reports you make. Also, not all punitive actions are externally visible.

funding

Donations toward infrastructure/hosting costs can be made through Ko-fi or Liberapay.

transparency

We have not received any warrants from law enforcement, nor participated in any discussions covered by an NDA.
Short: COVID-aware Twitter escapees â™¥ï¸ COVID content, science, resources, advocacy, social, meetup, chat, etc. (vanilla Mastodon w/5k chars, 6 poll Qs, BirdUI/Tangerine themes, AuthFetch, no Threads)

Description: Come on in, the water's fine.

About this Mastodon fork

The source code for this Mastodon fork can be found on GitHub. This fork is itself a fork of the glitch-soc fork, which adds numerous new features.

We support LaTeX. The $ $ syntax for inline math is disabled, as it has too many false positives; ( ) can be used for inline math, while both $$ $$ and [ ] can be used for displaystyle math. The backslashes may need to be escaped in Markdown mode.

This instance is part of the Union of Typeslut Verifiedâ„¢ï¸â€‹ Instances.

Donations

If you appreciate this instance, please consider supporting us on Patreon or Liberapay.

Attribution

This instance uses Mutant Standard emoji, which are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.
Short: A queer, leftist instance for programming languages enthusiasts and friends.

Description:
Actualizado por Ãºltima vez no 9 de maio de 2023

Benvide a mastodon.gal, a instancia para a comunidade galega do fediverso en mastodon.

GuÃ­a de uso

En mastodon.help tes unha guÃ­a de uso de mastodon bastante completa de como funciona mÃ¡stodon, que aplicaciÃ³ns existen e como migrar a tua conta dende unha instancia distinta.

Patrocinadores

Preguntas frecuentes (FAQ)

  • QuÃ© Ã© mastodon.gal?

    mastodon.gal Ã© unha instancia independiente e autoadministrada de mastodon, unha rede social de cÃ³digo aberto e descentralizada. EstÃ¡ pensada principalmente para a comunidade galega, polo que usamos unicamente o galego coma lÃ­ngua de comunicaciÃ³n oficial.

    AdemÃ¡is, somos unha instancia antifeixista, feminista, que apoia ao colectivo LGBTIQ+, e, principalmente, cun sentimento identitario galego no que facemos principal fincapÃ© na promociÃ³n da cultura e da lingua propia da Galiza.

    Es admins da instancia son @nekerafa e @lucycoella.

    Para apoiar a esta instancia, tes os seguintes enlaces:

    • LiberaPay: https://liberapay.com/mastodon.gal/donate
    • Ko-fi: https://ko-fi.com/mastodongal

    Toda esta informaciÃ³n a tes resumida na conta de @moderacion.

  • Non son galego/non sei falar galego, poderÃ­a entrar?

    Claro, estamos abertos para todas as galegas, usen ou non o galego coma lingua principal, asÃ­ coma a todas as persoas que queiran participar na nosa comunidade. Iso si, moitas das nosas usuarias falan galego principalmente, polo que teÃ±a en conta que moitas non queiran mudar a sua lingua se fala outra distinta (coma poder ser o castelÃ¡n).

  • O contido publicado nesta instancia a quen pertence?

    Ainda que o espazo en disco duro nos pertenza, o contido que estÃ¡ subido en todo momento pertence a usuaria que o sobeu. Nos non poÃ±emos limitaciÃ³ns de subir contido con copyright, sempre e cando sexas a persona dona do contido ou te pertenza (calquera contido con copyright de terceiros pode ser eliminado sen previo aviso). Como suxestiÃ³n, o mellor e subir contido sen copyright, ou podes indicar cal e a licencia do contido no texto alternativo da imaxe.

  • Toda a infraestructura de mastodon.gal e propia?

    Non. O noso dominio estÃ¡ comprado en Dinahosting, que Ã© o noso patrocinador actualmente da infraestructura (ofrÃ©cennos unha mÃ¡quina virtual con Debian 11 correndo con 3 vCPU con 6GB de RAM e 60GB de SSD). Ademais, nos usamos un provedor de servizos na nube (DigitalOcean) no que temos o servizo de DNS e o espacio en disco para multimedia nun servicio S3-like. Para o servizo de mail, temos contratado un provedor de mail (SendInBlue).

  • Podo utilizar este servidor para crear unha conta de bot?

    Non. Os bots estÃ¡n prohibidos nesta instancia, xa que os tratamos coma contas de spam. Para tratar bots podes usar a instancia de bots.automatica.dev.

CÃ³digo de conduta

Como paso antes de facerse unha conta, recomendamosche ler Netiqueta, que son as regras bÃ¡sicas polas que unha usuaria da Internet debe comportarse con outras usuarias. O resumo das mesmas estÃ¡ no apartado de abaixo desta pÃ¡xina.

AtribuciÃ³ns

Esta instancia usa o pack de emoticonas Mutant Standard emoji, o cal estÃ¡ baixo licencia Creative Commons AtribuciÃ³n-Non comercial-Compartir igual 4.0 Internacional.

TamÃ©n usa o pack de emoticonas Blobhaj de Heatherhorns, o cal estÃ¡ baixo licencia Creative Commons AtribuciÃ³n 4.0 Internacional.

O resto dos emotes pertencen aos seus respectivos donos.
Short: mastodon.gal Ã© unha instancia en galego de Mastodon para a comunidade galega.

Description:
The-Town

Resources for the Town of Merveilles.

Staff

  • Owners (Own the instance itself)
    • Somnius
    • Devine Lu Linvega
  • Administrators (Have access to the server infrastructure)
    • Sib Crash
  • Moderators (Have control over federation & invites)
    • Ã–ppen
    • Glyph
    • Rekka Bellum

Instance Values

  • A demand for technology and society to re-center around sustainability, longevity, and balance with an emphasis on renewable energy.
  • A focus on decentralization, community activism, social justice, and civic empowerment.
  • A recognition that economic, social, and ecological injustices are all deeply interconnected.

Instance Rules

  • One must respect the Code of Conduct.
  • One must remember the Three Gates Of Speech.
  • One must wear a Black & White avatar.

Introduction

Upon joining the instance, we recommend that you first add an avatar to your profile, and write a post that describes who you are, include the #introduction tag in your post. You should also consider pinning this to your profile.

Merveilles is Invite Only

We want to keep the instance small. The aim of the Town is to facilitate a discussion on the various projects created by members of the Merveilles community. So, that is why we are keeping things invite-only for the time being. This is intentional to reduce the overhead on the moderation team and to focus on our existing members more. You may only receive an invite if someone already on the instance recommends you to the moderation team for review. Merveilles members should reach out to Somnius or Devine to invite new people.

Updates & Improvements

We have a Trello Board. This is used to show what improvements or adjustments are being made to the instance. Please take a look, and if you have any suggestions, feel free to reach out to the admins.

Finances

This instance is funded by donations from Merveilles members, and a financial report is posted by Somnius each month that shows how much money is spent and received. If you would like to donate to keep the instance running, please feel free to do so on these platforms below. Any extra income over server expenses are used to fund Merveilles projects.

  • Patreon
  • Ko-Fi
  • OpenCollective
  • Liberapay

Cross-posting

For the time being, you are not allowed to automatically cross-post from other social networks to our instance. If it's found that you don't respond to cross-posted interactions from external accounts on the instance, you will be considered as lurking and will be removed. Using twitter atlinks, like @jack@twitter.com is also discouraged.

Animal Products

On this instance, we adopt non-speciesist values and keep our timeline free of animal cruelty. We do not allow pictures of dead animals, or animal products.

Brands & Products

While it is encouraged on the instance to share personal projects, it is discouraged to use the platform as a "brand", or to use your account solely to do repeated advertisement of products. You're welcome to add fundraising links to your profile description, and to share them on the local timeline from time to time.

NSFW

NSFW content is permitted, but only under these conditions:

  • Put your post under a Content Warning.
  • Include "nsfw" in the text of the Content Warning.

Do not post any content that is illegal in the US or EU.

Common Hashtags

This is a list of common hashtags and their meanings in the town:

  • #theLobby - General conversation, introduction
  • #theWorkshop - Personal Projects
  • #theStudio - Currently Listeningâ€¦
  • #theObservatory - Visual Inspiration
  • #theLudarium - Games and Interactive art
  • #theLibrary - Literature
  • #theCinema - Movies
  • #theFurnace - Programming, closer to the metal
  • #theFoundry - Raspberry Pi, Arduino, IoT
  • #theCartographer - Travel
  • #theGalley - Cuisine
  • #theCouture - Fashion
  • #theVent - To express own frustrations

Blocked Domains

Merveilles.town restricts content from some domains. This instance is intended to be a quiet, peaceful place to work on projects. To keep it that way, we restrict content from domains that go against our rules and Code of Conduct preemptively. Please refer to the blocklist to see the full list.
Short: Revel in the marvels of the universe. We are a collective of forward-thinking individuals who strive to better ourselves and our surroundings through constant creation.

Description:
A social space for BTS ARMY and KPop fans. To find out more visit: apobangpo.website.

Please note: We are actively moderating membership applications to avoid spam. Please make sure you include useful information when you signup, so we can identify you as a real fan.

Be Positive. Be Kind. Spread Joy. Borahae! ğŸ’œ

Please note:

  • You MUST be over 18 years to join this space.
  • Remember the Tannie Rule: Assume that Namjoon, Jin, Yoongi, Hobi, Jiminie, Tae and Jungkookie are reading everything you post â€¦ make them proud!
  • When you join the Apobangpo.Space server, you agree to abide by our Community Charter, Terms of Use and Privacy Policy.
  • We have a BTS bias, but celebrate KPop music and culture in general. Members are welcome to discuss all their favourite artists and anything else that takes their fancy - especially Music, Art, Books, FanFiction and Pop Culture.
  • Antis, solo stans, sasaengs, mantis and serious shippers are not welcome on the Apobangpo.space server.
  • Do not post airport photos, fansite photos, or images that violate the artist's privacy.

Our Community Charter (https://apobangpo.website/server-rules/) guides how our server is managed. Please read it before joining. Our main aim is to maintain a positive and inclusive vibe for everyone.

When signing up to Apobangpo.Space, you must read the Terms of Use (https://apobangpo.website/terms-of-use/), and the Privacy Policy (https://apobangpo.website/privacy-policy/) which explain your legal rights and responsibilities.

Apobangpo is run by Pixelcats aka Jo Kay with help from the #FediArmy community. You can find out more about the project at: https://apobangpo.website/about/.
Short: A fediverse home for BTS ARMY and KPop Fans. All welcome! Share your favourite  music, scream for your Idol(s), learn together. All fun and no drama. Bangtan Forever, ARMY forever. KPop Forever.

Description:
Rambling Readers is a friendly community of book lovers. You can track your reading, talk about books, write reviews, and discover what to read next.

We are a UK based instance of BookWyrm. Anyone is welcome to join and no particular genre is favoured. You can follow and interact with users on other BookWyrm instances and on Mastodon.

We are committed for the long term to the Bookwyrm project, to maintaining the Rambling Readers instance, and to ensuring a responsive and reliable user experience.

If you have any questions email admin@ramblingreaders.org. Follow us on Mastodon for updates.
Short: Rambling Readers is a friendly community of book lovers. You can track your reading, talk about books, write reviews, and discover what to read next. We are UK based.

Description:
About birds.town

Birds.town is primarily meant for people who are interested in birding and nature in general; most other people are, however, more than welcome to join as well! This instance is mainly intended to be used by speakers of German and / or English.

You can view the status over at https://status.birdtu.be/.

I am hoping to add quite a few custom bird-related emojis as well! So if you'd love to see some bird emojis, this is the place to be! (try :buzzard:, :crow: or :oystercatcher: for example).

All data is processed and stored in the EU.

Donations

If you wish to donate to birds.town and / or birdtu.be, you can do so via Liberapay. Simply visit https://de.liberapay.com/birds.town/. Donations are always voluntary, anonymous and people who donate do not get any benefits.

PeerTube instance

There is also a PeerTube instance accompanying this Mastodon server, namely birdtu.be. Be sure to check it out and register your account there and upload all your bird- and nature-related videos! :-)

Backups

I will do my best to back up the data on this server at least daily, but I do recommend that you sporadically export your data from this server manually as well. Backups are stored on a separate so-called Storage Box by Hetzner a backup server (see below) and, in addition to that, on my own HDD at home. I use mainly BorgBackup.

A second server at a different physical location can be spun up within roughly 10 minutes should the current server go down. It runs on much less powerful hardware, but it should be more than enough to keep the instance running until the actual server is back up. Beware, however, that the database on the backup may be => 1 day out of sync with the main server and that some media files may be missing.

Deletion of Instance

I will keep this instance running for as long as I can afford it. If you wish to donate to me, you are welcome to do so! Send me an email and we can work out how.

Should the deletion of the server become necessary, I will do my best to inform users at least three months prior to the removal so that you can backup your data and move to another instance.

Hardware and costs

The instance is, at present, running on a Hetzner Dedicated Root Server which costs roughly â‚¬40 per month. It has the following specs:

  • Intel Core i7-6700 (4 Cores, 8 Threads) @ up to 4 GHz
  • 2x HDD SATA 4.0 TB Enterprise (RAID 1)
  • 2x RAM 16384 MB DDR4
  • 1 Gbit/s Uplink
  • Location: FSN1 (Hetzner data centre in Germany)

Impressum â€” Angaben gemÃ¤ÃŸ Â§ 5 TMG

Marvin Johanning
Heeper Str. 214
33607 Bielefeld

Description:
About wargamers.social

A Mastodon instance for people who are interested in tabletop wargames of the board, card, and hex and counter variety.

If miniatures gaming is your thing, check out the instance hosted by Wargames, Soldiers & Strategy Magazine for like-minded hobbyists.

What can I post?

You're welcome to post about anything you want when the visibility is â€œUnlistedâ€ or â€œFor followersâ€. The Local timeline is â€œPublicâ€ and moderated. This is a community for wargamers about wargaming and the Local timeline should reflect topics related to the hobby. Weâ€™ll interpret â€œrelated to the hobbyâ€ liberally to encourage discussion, but draw the line at posts dealing with contemporary sexuality, gender, politics, race, or religion that denigrate others, or are intended to polarize the community. If youâ€™re not sure how a potential post will be received, be conservative and post it as â€œUnlistedâ€ or â€œFor followersâ€, or use content warnings. The server rules apply to all posts regardless of visibility. Please follow them.

Is it free?

It's free. One of appeals of Mastodon is that it's free of the data harvesting and monetization practices so common on the web today. If the operational costs become unmanageable, I'll bring it to the community and we can solve it together.

Daily backups

Full daily backups are done nightly so you can have the confidence that an outage will not erase all of your data.

Redundant administration of the server infrastructure

A second administrator is on hand to mitigate the risk of a life event preventing me from administering the environment.

Commitment to 12 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

Sometimes services shut down, it is the cycle of life. I commit to maintaining 12 months of operating costs on hand to ensure you have time to move to another instance in the event this instance shuts down.

Can I help?

Absolutely. Ping me and we can discuss how you can best contribute.
Short: Mastodon server for people who are interested in tabletop wargames of the board, card, and hex and counter variety.

Description:
About

Welcome to theATL.social, a regional US-based Mastodon server with a focus on the City of Atlanta, GA (US) and surrounding counties and cities.

Contribute to theATL.social's operations via OpenCollective â¤ï¸

  • More about this server: funding, FAQs

Contacts

Primary Admin Contact

  • Email: michael@theatl.social
  • Mastodon Username: @michael@theatl.social

Secondary Admin Contact

  • Email: theatl_admin@sigler.io
  • Mastodon Username: @r@theatl.social

How to join

  • Anyone who lives, works, or is otherwise interested in Atlanta is welcome to join.

Backups

  • The (PostgreSQL) database containing the records of this server is backed up in full multiple times per day. Backups are securely stored on a third-party storage location separate from the servers on which theATL.social operates.

Self-Promotion and Accounts for Commercial Purposes

  • âœ… Accounts for self-promotion (e.g., artists, businesses, etc.) are OK.
  • âœ… Accounts for Commercial Purposes, or on behalf of for-profit organizations are OK
  • â„¹ï¸ Note the exception regarding spam accounts, below:

Spam Accounts

Defintion

  • Spam accounts are defined as having one or more of the following characteristics:
    • Inauthentic accounts representing fictitious individuals and/or (actual or fictitious) organizations. The creation of inauthentic accounts may include the use of scraped images/text to falsely establish identity.
    • Accounts created for malicious purposes or for purposes of abusing server resources through mass DMs or other related activities.

Detection

  • Automated methods are utilized to screen for spam accounts. Accounts detected through automated methods are manually reviewed before further action is taken.

Mitigation and Appeal

  • Under most circumstances, if a spam account is detected, an email inquiry to the account's email address will be sent. If a response is not received within 7 days, and/or if responses do not provide satisfactory information, accounts may be subject to freezing and/or suspension.

  • Egregious examples of spam accounts will be subject to an immediate suspension. Upon suspension, the affected account will have the opportunity to appeal the suspension.

Reporting

  • Reports on the number and reasons for account suspensions will be provided on a periodic basis via newsletters or related communications.

Moderation

  • theATL.social wants to be a good citizen in the #fediverse and welcomes users who share that goal. Server rules are established and actively moderated to achieve this goal. Users are asked to kindly review Server Rules before participating or joining the server.

  • This server abides by the Mastodon Server Covenant

FYI

  • Server maintenance typically occurs on the weekend. Potential offline periods will be announced, when possible, in advance.
  • Full-text search is not yet available due to associated costs, but may be implemented in the future, pending additional contributions.
  • If this server is unable to continue operation due to lack of funding or other reasons, users will have at least three months (90 days) notice to migrate their accounts to other servers.
  • Please inquire with the admin before creating bot accounts.

Additional Information

  • about.theatl.social provides additional information and resources.

ğŸ“¸ Credit: by Greg Keelen on Unsplash
Short: theATL.social is a regional-focused Mastodon server for those living, working, or otherwise interested in the Metro Atlanta, Georgia (USA) area.

Description:
This is a safe refuge from the publishing madness. This Mastodon instance is dedicated to self-published indie authors and their fans to talk about great books, the writing craft, the business of self-publishing, and the indie authors' journey. We also provide a Mastodon Relay to provide increased connectivity to other author and writing-centric instances across the Fediverse.

This instance is fueled by the love of storytelling & the goodwill of Authors-Helping-Authors. Sadly, servers don't run on goodwill. If you find value in IAS, please donate here

Here are top-line things you need to know about IAS:

  • All decisions align to this: Authors-Helping-Authors
  • Intolerant/hateful communications are not permitted
  • We are an open and non-judging group
  • We don't throw shade on ANY book genres
  • If you are a human residing on this planet, you are welcome here
  • We respect each member's lifestyle, whatever it may be (but legal under US Federal statutes)
  • We aren't here to attack others for their views
  • We aren't here to SPAM ours or other's books (mentions are OK)
  • This isn't a place to put your non-book ads (e.g., if most of your toots are promoting your author services--please don't)
  • There are many important topics, issues, news items, and hobbies. Indie Authors Social, by design, narrowly focuses on one theme: books, the people that write them, self-publish them, and the people that read them
  • Moderation of users and instances is a work of consensus and core to the Fediverse. On IAS, moderation-by-consensus will always be the go-to approach for local and external content, but in the case of blatant or egregious violations, IAS admins may take immediate steps to moderate users or instances
  • Operated out of the USA by Uncanny Publishing, LLC

If you are new to Mastodon, you can find a great Getting Started Guide here

For DMCA Takedown requests, contact: support@uncanny.it
Short: This server is dedicated to self-published, indie authors who want to help, encourage, and socialize with other indies. It's also for all the fans that love and support indie authors.

Description:
The first mastodon instance for all things New Jersey. You don't have live in the Garden State to join because you can love New Jersey from anywhere in the world.

Founded November 22nd, 2022. Added to JoinMastodon.org on December 19th. Managed Hosting by Cloudplane. Check their Server Status Page to see any issues.

Costs

Sadly running a Mastodon instance is not free. At the moment Stefan is paying all the costs but over time to community owned and paid for.

current expenses:

  • â‚¬33.39 a month - For Cloudplane server costs. Here is the itemized list from cloudplane:
    • â‚¬5.72 Storage - Database (gigabyte-hours)
    • â‚¬3.63 Storage - Files (gigabyte-hours)
    • â‚¬24.04 Instance - Medium (hours)
  • $29.99 a year - Domain registration at Dreamhost.com

Keep us online and join our patreon!

Moderation by:

  • Stefan Hayden

Contact Stefan if you interested in being a fellow moderator.

Adhering to the Mastodon Server Covenant:

  1. Active moderation against racism, sexism, homophobia and transphobia
  2. Daily backups
  3. At least one other person with emergency access to the server infrastructure
  4. Commitment to give users at least 3 months of advance warning in case of shutting down

Find other mastodon instances by location here.
Short: A place for all things New Jersey. You don't have live in the Garden State to join because you can love New Jersey from anywhere in the world.

Description:
Basic rules:

  1. Be nice.
  2. Adult posts are fine. But if youâ€™re going to do them, check the CW icon that says â€œAdd Content Warningâ€ and briefly describe (in a non-explicit language) the contents of your post (e.g. "NSFW contains nudity" or "NSFW contains adult language"), so those that do not wish to view it arenâ€™t forced to.
  3. No hate speech. No one wants to hear your homophobic, transphobic, antisemitic bullshit. And we certainly don't wanna hear it here.
  4. No copyrighted or lifted photos. A basic rule of thumb, if it's not your photo don't post it here. "Boost" someone's post, don't just steal it.
  5. No pictures or videos of abuse or cruelty to humans and animals. There's enough of that horrible shit on the internet. I don't want it here.
Short: Mastodon Server for the LGBT+ Bear Community. Be Nice. Be over 18 years old. Fill out "Why do you want to join?" so we know you're here for the right reasons.

Description:
Community for and about Jacksonville Beach and surrounding areas. Mostly local interests but anyone can join and everyone is welcome!

Please read and follow our Posting Guidelines.

We have lots more info on our Info Page!
Short: Community for and about Jacksonville Beach, Neptune Beach, Atlantic Beach, Ponte Vedra Beach and Jacksonville on Florida's First Coast.

Description:
We are building Equel as the safest and most productive professional community platform.

Unlike most other platforms, we require our members to use their real identities to facilitate building trust and a professional reputation. We ensure real identities by asking our members to authenticate with LinkedIn.

This community is for you if:

  • You are an entrepreneur and want to grow your business.
  • You are a creator and want to achieve thought leadership in the area of your expertise.
  • You want to advocate a cause that you deeply care about.
  • You want to mingle and discuss with like-minded professionals to learn from them.

Our mobile apps on App and Play Stores have the following features:

  • professional communities
  • topic-based group chats
  • discovery of people, communities, chats, and posts
  • cross-posting to LinkedIn
  • this all in a gorgeous and familiar user experience

Our shared values

We expect all our members to adhere to the following values:

Give First. Always contribute to others before asking for help or favors. It is easy, and it makes you a good person.

Be inclusive. Support one another, including underrepresented people. We reward actions that bring people together and include them in discussions.

Be responsible. Algorithms can turn your influence into a superpower: use it responsibly to further good causes. Donâ€™t use your power to attack, but to heal.

Foster genuine interactions. Be fully engaged in conversations, take the time to explain your point of view, and seek to understand the other person. Help us stay spam-free by reporting spammy content, such as repetitive comments or unsolicited commercial outreaches.

Be mindful, respectful, and honest. Be respectful of people: think before reacting, respect membersâ€™ privacy, avoid defamation, and credit people when due. Seek to create a safe space to build the trust needed for deeper connections.

When you choose to join our community, you have implied that you agree with our values and will follow our rules for posting and participating. We will moderate accordingly.

Moderation Principles

Reported content will be assessed on a balance of probabilities by the moderators. In other words, whether it is more likely than not that the content violates one or more of these rules. We will suspend an account from equel.social when the user demonstrates that they have breached any rule several times or if their content (including profile description) suggests that they are likely to continue to break the rules. The number of breaches leading to suspension is deliberately not defined. In egregious cases, one breach can result in the suspension of the user account.

Offering a safe space to our members is paramount. We take a pragmatic approach to every report we receive - if we feel that a problematic post isnâ€™t explicitly a breach of any of these rules but is inappropriate for equel.social, the post will likely be removed. Users who repeatedly post problematic content or are seen by the administrators as a negative, disruptive presence in our community will be removed, even if those posts or the user did not explicitly violate our rules.

Staff

This server has the following administrators and moderators: @Serena @Mikko @Aarni
Short: Equel is a safe and diverse community of professionals for networking and learning. We require members to use their real identities by authenticating their account with LinkedIn.
